area.name: A1S
area.item:
Definition
Virtual host name used for the database instance.

Use
If you do not plan to use virtual host names, set this parameter to the (short) physical host name of the server on which you are installing the A1S system.

Definition
Virtual host name used for the SAP liveCache instance.

Use
If you do not plan to use virtual host name, set this parameter to the (short) physical host name of the server on which you are installing the SAP system.

Definition
Virtual host name used for the SAP liveCache instance.

Use
If you want to install all A1S in one database, you cannot set this parameter, because the SAP liveCache instance is the same as the database instance and cannot have a separate host name.

Definition
Virtual host name used for the SCS and primary application server instance.
Use
If you do not plan to use virtual host names, set this parameter to the (short) physical host name of the server on which you are installing the SAP system.

Definition
Virtual host name used for the TREX instance.

Use
If you do not plan to use virtual host names, set this parameter to the (short) physical host name of the server on which you are installing the SAP system.

Use
Enter the license server host name to connect your SAP system to this license server.

Use
Enter the license server port to connect your SAP system to this license server.

Use
If you want to use a license server, mark this check box.

Use
You can specify the size of your system. Software Provisioning Manager preconfigures the system according to this specification.

area.name: CE
area.item:
Definition
Directory where the update files have been downloaded to.

Use
Specify the directory where the files from SAP Service Marketplace (SMP) should be downloaded to.
The update tool will then read these files directly from that location.

Definition
Displays the list of files that will be downloaded.

Definition
Specifies when the content of the update files is to be downloaded

Use
You can either download the update files right now or later during the actual update phase.

Use
Select the components to be installed in your SAP NetWeaver CE system.

Definition
Allows to select whether to search for component-relevant support packages only or search for latest SP-relevant patches.

Use
Deselecting the checkbox will result in downloading the version of Software Components which is part of the latest Support Package stack.
Selecting the checkbox means that for each JavaEE Component the latest patch that is relevant for the latest Support Package stack will be downloaded. This can be used for finding and downloading patches that were released after the last update of your system even if no new Support Package is available.

Dependencies
Patches for the current support package of the system will be downloadable only if there is no newer support package available. Once a new support package is released it contains all corrections that were contained in component patches for the previous support package.

Example
If the system has support package n the behaviour depends on the availability of updates and the selection of this checkbox as follows:
  • Checkbox is deselected and last SP on SMP is n: The system is considered up-to-date as n is already installed on the system and components-specific patches will not be searched for.
  • Check box is deselected and the last SP on SMP is >n: The last Support Package Stack will be offered for download and all components will be downloaded with patchlevel 0.
  • Check box is selected and last SP on SMP is n: The components (if any) that have newer patches released than the ones on the system will be downloaded
  • Check box is selected and last SP on SMP is >n: The last Support Package Stack will be offered for download and all components will be downloaded with their latest patchlevels.

Definition
If you want to index documents and Web pages on external servers you should specify a proxy server (e.g. for security reasons).

Use
Specifiy the host name and domain of the proxy server.

Example
proxy.mylocation.mycompany.com

Use
Specify the port of the proxy server.

Example
8080

Definition
SAP system ID of SAP NetWeaver Composition Environment (CE) system to be updated

Definition
Select whether updates should be searched on SAP Service Marketplace or taken from a local directory.

Use
If SAP Service Markeplace (SMP) is selected this service allows you to search for newer Support Package Stacks, SP-relevant patches or Enhancement Packages for your product.
If Inbox directory containing the updates is selected then this service will prompt for a directory that contains the already downloaded updates and then apply them to your system.

Dependencies
To search for updates on SAP Service Marketplace you need to have a service user created.

Definition
User for SAP Service Marketplace (SMP), also known as S-user.

Use
With the SMP user, you log on to SAP Service Marketplace to download updates.

Definition
Password for SAP Service Marketplace (SMP) user

Use
With the SMP user, you log on to SAP Service Marketplace to download updates.

Definition
Allows to select the new Enhancement Package to be downloaded.

Use
Select the target Enhancement Package to download.

Dependencies
Values shown in the list are the ones that are modelled as successors for your product on SAP Service Marketplace. The tool will only allow you to continue if it supports update to the target version or finds an self-update that supports such an update.

Definition
Allows you to select whether to stay on the current Enhancement Package and search for corrections or find newer Enhancement Packages.

Use
Selecting Corrections for the currently installed Enhancement Package means that the service will try to find the newest available corrections. This search can return newer Support Packages or patches (if searching for latest patches is enabled) that are applicable for the system.
Only the latest support package is returned in both cases.

Definition
<What is this field for? What does this field mean?>

Use
<What happens when I enter a value or set an flag? Under what circumstances do I use the field? What do I enter in this field and why (no specific values)?>

Dependencies
<What other fields or functions does this field influence? Are there other effects that I might not expect? Are there restrictions? >

Example
<Is this field has a certain value or setting, what happens?>

Definition
Specifies which update files are to be used

Use
You can choose to use update files already located in your inbox directory or to download new update files from SAP Service Marketplace (SMP).

Definition
Allows you to use a proxy server for connecting to SAP Service Marketplace.

Use
If selected, the values of the address and the port number for the proxy server are used for connecting to the SAP Service Marketplace.

Definition
User of SAP NetWeaver Composition Environment (CE) system to be updated

Use
With this user, you log on to the application server of your CE system.

area.name: common
area.item:
Definition
User with authorization to perform remote function calls (RFC) in a SAP system based on AS ABAP

Example
You can enter the user DDIC for example. This user is automatically created with the appropriate authorizations during the installation of a SAP system based on AS ABAP.

Use
Choose this option to activate the ICF services /sap/public/icf_info and all subnodes in your SAP system based on AS ABAP.

Use
Browse for the location where you have copied the credential file of Adobe Document Services.
The file is copied to:
/usr/sap/<SAPSID>/<INSTANCE><xx>/j2ee/cluster/server<x>/persistent/com.adobe~TrustManagerService/trust/credentials

Dependencies
For more information on how to obtain the file, see the installation guide.

Definition
SAP Agent Administrator account

Use
The group ID of the group has to be the same throughout the SAP system.
To use the default value, leave this field blank.

Definition
Home directory of the SAP Agent Administrator account

Definition
Login shell of the SAP Agent Administrator account

Definition
Primary group of the SAP Agent Administrator

Use
The user ID of the SAP Agent Administrator account has to be the same throughout the SAP system.
To use the default value, leave this field blank.

Use
Host name of an application server instance of the SAP system

Definition
Instance name of an application server instance of the SAP system

Use
Instance number of an application server instance of the SAP system

Definition
Specifies where the SAP Web Dispatcher obtains the meta-information about the back-end system - profile parameter SID

Use
Enter the media label.

Dependencies
The signature of the media whose location you enter here is checked automatically. Keep in mind that this automatic check is only committed once and not repeated if you modify artefacts such as SAR archives or files on the media after the initial check has been done - that is if you modify artefacts later on either during the remaining Define Parameters phase or later on during the Execute Service phase the signature is not checked again.

Definition
Name of the required medium
Note that several software packages can reside on one medium. Each software package is identified in a dedicated LABEL.ASC file.

Use
This screen appears if the Software Provisioning Manager wants to check or cannot find the file LABEL.ASC on the medium that contains a valid identifier for the required software package.

Dependencies
Enter the path to the location of the required software package in the Package Location column.
The signature of the media whose location you enter here is checked automatically. Keep in mind that this automatic check is only committed once and not repeated if you modify artefacts such as SAR archives or files on the media after the initial check has been done - that is if you modify artefacts later on either during the remaining Define Parameters phase or later on during the Execute Service phase the signature is not checked again.

Use
  • Flag is selected
    The Software Provisioning Manager verifies whether the location entered in the Package Location column is the correct package for the installation. To do this, the Software Provisioning Manager checks the content of the file LABEL.ASC in the given location.
  • Flag is unselected
    The Software Provisioning Manager skips the check.

Dependencies
  • You enter the path in column Package Location and select the Check Location flag .
    Result: the Software Provisioning Manager checks the label location and displays an error message if the location is incorrect. If all locations are correct, the Software Provisioning Manager does not prompt you again later.
  • You do not enter a Package Location and leave the Check Location flag deselected.
    Result: the Software Provisioning Manager skips the check and you can continue the installation procedure. However, the Software Provisioning Manager prompts you later for the missing package.
  • You enter the path of the Package Location and leave the Check Location flag deselected.
    Result: the Software Provisioning Manager skips checking the label location, but your entered package locations are used later for the installation. The Software Provisioning Manager then only prompts you again for a missing LABEL.ASC if the package location is incorrect.
  • The signature of the media whose location you enter here is checked automatically. Keep in mind that this automatic check is only committed once and not repeated if you modify artefacts such as SAR archives or files on the media after the initial check has been done - that is if you modify artefacts later on either during the remaining Define Parameters phase or later on during the Execute Service phase the signature is not checked again.

Definition
The target location to which the software package is to be copied.

Use
You can copy the software packages available on the medium to target locations.
Note that for each row in the Software Package Request table, a separate target location is required.

Dependencies
The signature of the media whose location you enter here is checked automatically. Keep in mind that this automatic check is only committed once and not repeated if you modify artefacts such as SAR archives or files on the media after the initial check has been done - that is if you modify artefacts later on either during the remaining Define Parameters phase or later on during the Execute Service phase the signature is not checked again.

Definition
Each medium contains one or more software packages.

Use
Enter the path to the location of the required software package.
You can enter the location of a:
  • LABEL.ASC file
  • Directory that contains a LABEL.ASC file
  • LABELIDX.ASC file if available
  • Directory that contains a LABELIDX.ASC file
A LABELIDX.ASC file lists the names of subdirectories that contain further LABEL.ASC files.

Dependencies
If there is a complete medium available on the installation host, you only need to enter the path to the root directory of the medium in the Package Location column.
The signature of the media whose location you enter here is checked automatically. Keep in mind that this automatic check is only committed once and not repeated if you modify artefacts such as SAR archives or files on the media after the initial check has been done - that is if you modify artefacts later on either during the remaining Define Parameters phase or later on during the Execute Service phase the signature is not checked again.

Definition
Check whether the syntax of the split rules file is valid (<tablename>:<number of parts>:<key>[;<key>])

Use
You have to browse for the split rules file. It checks the file syntax, and if it is wrong, you have to retry the step after removing the wrong entry. The wrong entry is logged in the default log file.

Definition
Allows you to configure the data load
You do not need to configure the settings now because you can perform the installation with the installation settings.

Dependencies
Only certified database administrators should perform this step.

Use
Mark this checkbox to configure a connection to the message server of a back-end system in the SAP Web Dispatcher profile. If you unmark this checkbox, you must configure the connection to the back-end system later.

Definition
Allows you to configure the task file generation
You do not need to configure the settings now because you can perform the installation with the installation settings.

Dependencies
Only certified database administrators should perform this step.

Use
The SAP Host Agent is required for monitoring system instances. Confirm that you want to uninstall it anyway, even though system instances are still installed on this host.

Definition
Confirm the warning.

Use
Select this option to confirm the warning. Otherwise, the check is performed again, and the warning might occur again.

Definition
Continues a stopped installation

Use
Try to solve the cause of the stoppage first.
If the same cause is detected again, the Software Provisioning Manager asks you again whether you want to continue or to interrupt the installation.

Use
If this option is selected, OS user accounts are created automatically for the database type that is selected below.

Use
Enter the attach name (DB2 SSID) which is used to attach to the DB2 subsystem.

Use
Enter the SAP code page that is used by your system.

Use
Enter the host name of the database host.
To find out the host name, enter host name in the command prompt of the database host.

Definition
The database ID <DBSID> is the identifier for the database instance.

Dependencies
The <DBSID> must meet the following conditions:
  • It is unique throughout your organization.
  • It can be different from the SAP system ID <SAPSID> and consists of exactly three alphanumeric characters.
  • It only contains uppercase letters.
  • The first character is a letter (not a digit).
  • It must not include the IDs listed in SAP Note 1979280 because they are reserved and cannot be used.

Definition
The database ID (DBSID) is the identifier for the database instance.

Dependencies
  • If you want to install your SAP system with a new database instance:
    Enter the database ID (DBSID) for the database instance to be created. The DBSID must meet the following requirements:
    • The chosen DBSID will be the name for the System ID and the tenant database.
    • It must be unique throughout your organization.
    • It is recommended to be different from the SAP system ID (SAPSID) and must consist of exactly three alphanumeric characters.
    • Only uppercase letters are allowed.
    • The first character must be a letter (not a digit).
    • It must not include the IDs listed in SAP Note 1979280 because they are reserved and cannot be used.
    Choose your DBSID carefully. Renaming is complicated and requires you to reinstall the SAP system.
  • If you want to install your SAP system in an existing database instance:
    Enter the DBSID of the existing database instance to which you want to add the SAP system. If it does not yet exist, a new database tenant will be created.

Definition
The database ID (DBSID) is the identifier for the database instance.

Use
Enter the DBSID of your SAP system.

Use
Enter the location name of the DB2 subsystem you wish to access on the database server.

Dependencies
To find out the location name, contact your DB2 for z/OS DBA. Your DBA can check the MVS syslog for message DSNL004I. "LOCATION" contains the location name. The -DISPLAY DDF command provides this information.

Use
Enter the virtual host name of the database cluster group.

Definition
Database schema

Use
Enter the appropriate database schema for your system.

Dependencies
The database schema consists of SAP<SAPSID>.

Use
Specify the connectivity data of the database.

Enter the appropriate database schema for your system.
The database schema is named SAP<SCHEMA_ID>. <SCHEMA_ID> can be any name consisting of letters and numbers.
The default value is SAPABAP1.
You can either accept this default or enter another value according to your needs.

Definition
Schema is used as the creator of DB2 objects, like tables and indexes. The default is SAP<SID>. To install an additional SAP system to the same database (MCOD), specify a different value.

Use
Enter the schema name which is used as the CREATOR of DB2 objects.

Use
You can only choose SAP HANA Database.

Definition
Allows you to load the database packages in a customer-defined order

Use
The file order_by.txt defines the load order of packages.
You can do one of the following:
  • Prepare the file by yourself and copy it to the installation directory now
  • Let the installation procedure create the file with the default load order and then you can modify this order in the subsequent screen
If you do not select this option, the database packages are loaded according to their size, starting with the largest package.

Definition
Lets you unload the database packages in a customer-defined order

Use
The file order_by.txt defines the unload order of packages.
You can do one of the following:
  • Prepare the file by yourself and copy it to the installation directory now
  • Let the installation create the file with the default unload order and then you can modify this order in the subsequent screen
If you do not select this option, the database packages are unloaded in alphabetical order, according to their names.

Use
Choose whether you want to create the <sapsid>adm and SAPService<SAPSID> users:
  • In the domain of the user who is performing the installation: Use domain of current user
  • In a domain that is different from the domain of the user who is installing the SAP system: Use different domain

Dependencies
If you want to use the domain of the current user, the users <sapsid>adm and SAPService<SAPSID>) can only be created during the installation if the account used for the installation of the SAP system has domain administrator rights in the relevant domain. If not, a user with domain administrator rights has to create these users before the installation is started. For more information, see the installation guide.

If you want to use a different domain, you have to specify the Windows domain. The users <sapsid>adm and SAPService<SAPSID> can only be created in the different domain during the installation if the account used for the installation of the SAP system has domain administrator rights in the other domain. If not, a user with domain administrator rights for this domain has to create these users in this domain before the installation is started. For more information, see the installation guide.

Use
Specify whether you want to create the <sapsid>adm and SAPService<SAPSID> users:
  • On the local computer: Local installation
  • In the domain of the user who is performing the installation: Use domain of current user
  • In a different domain from that of the user who is installing the SAP system: Use different domain

The SAP Host Agent user sapadm is used for central monitoring services. The installer creates this user by default as a local user although it is not a member of the local Administrators group.
If required, you can change this user to become a domain user on the Parameter Summary screen. For more information, see the installation guide. For security reasons, however, SAP strongly recommends you to create this user as a local user.

Dependencies
If you want to use the domain of the current user, the <sapsid>adm and SAPService<SAPSID> users can only be created by the installation if the account used for the installation of the SAP system has domain administrator rights in the relevant domain. If not, a user with domain administrator rights has to create these users before the installation is started. For more information, see the installation guide.
If the current user is a local user, a local installation is performed on the local computer.

If you want to use a different domain, you have to specify the Windows domain.
The users <sapsid>adm and SAPService<SAPSID> can only be created in the other domain by the installation if the account used for the installation of the SAP system has domain administrator rights in the other domain. If not, a user with domain administrator rights for this domain has to create these users in this domain before the installation is started. For more information, see the installation guide.

Only choose to create the users on the local computer if you do not want to install:
  • Multiple application servers (additional application server instances) or SAP systems that use a common transport directory. If you choose this option, you can only access the SAP system from another computer if the same user with the same password exists on both computers and both computers belong to the same domain or workgroup, or if you authenticate the session with user name and password.
  • A high-availability system with Microsoft Failover Cluster (MSFC)

Definition
Installs the SAP system in an already existing database by using a specific database schema

Dependencies
The existing database must have the same released version as it is committed for the SAP system you install.

Use
SAP system database executables are already installed on your host
Decide whether you want to extract the executables again or not.
If you are not sure what to do, extract them again.

Use
SAP system executables are already installed on your host.
Decide whether you want to extract the executables again or not.
If you are not sure what to do, extract them again.

Use
SAP gateway executables are already installed on your host.
Decide whether you want to extract the executables again or not.
If you are not sure what to do, extract them again.

Definition
Virtual or physical host name of the file share host, where central files of the ASCS instance will be stored.

Dependencies
You have already configured a share named sapmnt on that host. The user performing the installation requires full control over the share.

Definition
FQDN is the fully qualified domain name for an IP address. It consists of the host name and the domain name: <host name>.<domain name>

Use
Enter the DNS domain name for the SAP system. The DNS domain name is appended to the server name to calculate the FQDN.

Dependencies
DNS has to be configured so that the FQDN can be resolved to an IP address.

Example
If your application server host is named kirk.wdf.sap.com, you have to enter wdf.sap.com.

Use
If you want to use HTTP based URL frameworks - for example, Web Dynpro applications - you have to select this checkbox.

Definition
Port of the SAP system gateway

Definition
Security port of the SAP system gateway

Use
Enter the name of the service of the SAP system gateway

Use
Enter the group ID for the user shown, making sure that the ID is unique

Definition
Group ID of the user <sapsid>adm

Dependencies
You can optionally create the user <sapsid>adm manually before the installation.
You must create the user <sapsid>adm manually if you are using Network Information Service (NIS), and you do not want to de-activate NIS during the installation.
Take account of the following requirements for the user creation:
  • The user ID must be the same on all hosts.
  • The group ID must be the same on all hosts.
<sapsid>adm must be a member of the group sapsys.

If you do not create the user manually, the user is created automatically.

Definition
The number of parallel jobs for importing data and the load order of the packages is dynamically adjusted depending on the capacity of the SAP HANA database server.

Use
This option is recommended for system copies with the target as SAP HANA database. If you want to manually specify the number of parallel jobs for importing data and a special package load order, do not select this option.

Dependencies
The number of parallel jobs for importing data and a special package load order cannot be modified if this option is selected.

Use
Enter the home directory for the specified user.

Definition
The home directory for the specified user

Use
Enter the home directory for the specified user. Make sure that you enter a home directory that is not critical for recursive changes to permissions.

Dependencies
When operating system users are created by the Software Provisioning Manager, the permissions on the home directories of these users are changed recursively. This can cause unpredictable errors if you define a critical home directory.

Example
Do not enter / or /usr/sap as the home directory.

Definition
Name of the host on which the transport directory is located. The transport directory is used by the SAP transport system to store transport data and change SAP system information, such as software programs, data dictionary data, or customization data.

Use
When you install an SAP system, you have to decide which transport host and directory you want to use for your SAP system:
  • Use the transport directory that Software Provisioning Manager creates during the installation of the SAP system by default on the global host:
    Software Provisioning Manager by default creates the transport directory on the global host as follows:
    UNIX: /usr/sap/trans
    Windows: \usr\sap\trans
  • Use a transport directory located on a host other than the default host:
    • You can use an existing transport directory and host in your SAP system landscape.
    • You can set up a new transport directory on a different host.
Dependencies
The SAP global host is the host on which the global directories (global, exe, profile) physically reside.

Use
Check the archive that you want to be installed.

Definition
ASP where the SAP base directory (/usr/sap) will be installed.

Dependencies
If you select an independent ASP, the directory usr/sap is created under ASP /<Destination ASP device> instead of Root(/).

Definition
Path where the application should be installed

Definition
Drive where the SAP base directory (\usr\sap) is installed

Dependencies
If the share saploc already exists, you cannot select the local drive.

Example
If you select D:, the directory usr\sap is created on drive D.

Definition
SAP liveCache is an in-memory object store technology that is used to speed up material planning scenarios in SAP Supply Chain Management (SCM).

Use
Select this option to enable your SAP System to use SAP liveCache integrated in SAP HANA.

Dependencies
The SAP liveCache integrated in SAP HANA (also called LCAPPS or liveCache Applications plugin) must be already installed.

Use
Enter the name of the host on which the specific instance runs.
To find out the host name, enter the command host name in the command prompt of the host on which the instance runs.

Definition
Technical identifier for internal processes, consists of a two-digit number from 00 to 97

Use
  • If you are installing a primary application server instance or a standalone gateway:
    Enter the instance number that should be created.The instance number must be unique on a host. That is, if more than one SAP instance is running on the same host, these instances must be assigned different numbers.

  • If you are installing a database instance:
    Enter exactly the number of the primary application server instance that you entered during the installation of the primary application server instance.To find out the number on the host of the primary application server instance, look under the SAP directory usr/sap/<SAPSID>/DVEBMGS<nn> (on UNIX) or usr\sap\<SAPSID>\DVEBMGS<nn> (on Windows).
    The value <nn> is the number assigned to the primary application server instance.

  • If you are installing an additional application server instance (Screen for parameters of the additional application server instance):
    Enter the instance number to be created.The instance number must be unique on a host. That is, if more than one SAP instance is running on the same host, these instances must be assigned different numbers.

  • If you are installing an additional application server instance (Screen for parameters of the primary application server instance):
    Enter exactly the number of the primary application server instance that you entered during the installation of the primary application server instance.To find out the number on the host of the primary application server instance, look in the SAP directory /usr/sap/<SAPSID>/DVEBMGS<nn> (on UNIX) or <Drive>:\usr\sap\<SAPSID>\DVEBMGS<nn> (on Windows).
    The value <nn> is the number assigned to the primary application server instance.

Dependencies
  • HP-UX:
    Do not use the following numbers:
    • 02 – This number is used by the operating system to determine the port number for report RSLGCOLL, which is 14<Instance Number> by default. However, port 1402 is already used by the OS process rstlisten. If you decide to use 02 as the instance number anyway, the instance fails to start during the installation process. You then have to change the port number for report RSLGCOLL manually to continue with the installation.
    • 75 - This number is used by the operating system. For more information, see SAP Note 29972.
  • Windows:
    Do not use the following numbers:
    • 43 - This number is used by Microsoft Failover Cluster (MSFC).
    • 89 - This number is used by Windows Terminal Server (WTS).

Use
Enter the instance number of the central ABAP system to which you want to connect.
To find out the number on the host of the primary application server instance, look in the SAP directory:
  • UNIX: /usr/sap/<SAPSID>/DVEBMGS<nn>
  • Windows: <Drive>:\usr\sap\<SAPSID>\DVEBMGS<nn>
The value <nn> is the number assigned to the SAP system.

Definition
Technical identifier for internal processes; consists of a two-digit number between 00 and 97

Use
Enter the instance number that you want to use for this specific instance.

Dependencies
  • If more than one SAP instance is running on the same host, you must assign these instances different numbers.
  • AIX:
    If you are using NIM Service Handler (NIMSH), do not use 01 or 02 for the instance number. Software Provisioning Manager uses the instance number for the internal message server port 39<Instance Number>.
  • HP-UX:
    Do not use the following numbers:
    • 02 – used by the operating system
      This number is used to determine the port number for report RSLGCOLL, which is 14<Instance Number> by default.
      However, the port 1402 is already used by the OS process rstlisten. If you decide to use 02 as the instance number anyway, the instance fails to start during the installation process. You must then manually change the port number for report RSLGCOLL to continue with the installation.
    • 75 - used by the operating system
      For more information, see SAP Note 29972.
  • Windows:
    Do not use the following numbers:
    • 43 - used by Microsoft Failover Cluster Service (MSFC)
    • 89 - used by Windows Terminal Server (WTS)

Use
Enter the instance number of the SAP HANA database to which you want to connect.
To find out the SAP HANA database instance number, check the HDB directory in the HANA host:

/usr/sap/<System ID>/HDB<nn>

The value <nn> is the number assigned to the SAP HANA database instance.

Use
Enter the instance number of the Java system to which you want to connect.
To find out the number on the host of the primary application server instance, look in the SAP directory:
  • UNIX:/usr/sap/<SAPSID>/DVEBMGS<nn>
  • Windows:<Drive:>\usr\sap\<SAPSID>\DVEBMGS<nn>
The value <nn> is the number assigned to the SAP system.

Definition
RAM that should be reserved for the SAP system instance. The displayed default value is the entire RAM.

Dependencies
Depending on the amount of data involved, the requirements might change. For a more precise sizing definition that reflects your particular system load:
  • Use the SAP Quick Sizer tool available at https://sap.com/sizing.
  • Contact a hardware vendor.
  • Contact the person in charge of installation or your Competence Center.

.

Definition
Swap space that should be reserved for the SAP instance. The displayed default value is the entire swap space.

Dependencies
Be sure that the instance swap space is at least three times the instance RAM.
Depending on the amount of data involved, the requirements might change. For a more precise sizing definition that reflects your particular system load:
  • Use the SAP Quick Sizer tool available at https://sap.com/sizing.
  • Contact a hardware vendor.
  • Contact the person in charge of installation or your Competence Center.

A random word or phrase that is used to encrypt the secure store. The Java EE engine uses this phrase to generate the key that is used to encrypt the data.
  • If you are performing a system copy, you must specify the key phrase of the source system.
  • If you are performing an installation, the master password is used by default, unless you specify another value.

Dependencies
The uniqueness of the phrase you use contributes to the uniqueness of the resulting key. Therefore, we recommend that you use a long key phrase that cannot easily be guessed. Use both uppercase and lowercase letters in the phrase and include special characters. The key phrase must be 8 to 30 characters long.

Definition
By selecting "Package Split", the default export.xml and import.xml packages are split up into multiple packages (with each no larger than the specified package split size).
Exception: If a single table is larger than the package-split size, it will be put into a separate package but will not be split. Use the "Table Split" option to split this table.

Use
You must always split packagea as it speeds up the time required for exporting and importing database content. The default number of parallel export or import jobs is twice the number of CPUs, which means you should create at least as many packages as export or import jobs that can run in parallel.

Example
By default, you get 8 export jobs with 4 CPUs: You should therefore create at least 8 packages for the export.

Definition
Defines the package-split size limit. You can either specify a number without a unit (in this case "bytes" is assumed) or provide the unit:
K for KB
M for MB
G for GB
T for TB

Use
If you select "Package Split", you have to define the package-split size. The default export.xml and import.xml packages are split up into multiple packages (with each no larger than the specified package split size). The size of a package depends on the size of the objects it contains.

Example
200M; 8G

Definition
While package splitting results in the smallest entity "table" (at least one table for each package), table splitting allows you to split single tables into smaller packages with each containing a subset of the split table.

Use
You must configure table splitting if your database contains large or complex tables that have a long processing time during export or import. If you choose to perform table splitting, in a "Split Rules File" you have to configure which tables are to be split and how to split them.

Definition
The "Split Rules File" is a simple text file that contains a list of tables to be split and an instruction on how to split each table.
The "Split Rules File" has the following format:
<table name>:<number of packages>:[<key1>;<key2>]
with
<table name>: Name of the table to be split
<number of packages>: Number of packages the table is to be split into
<key>: Column of <table table> name to be used in the "Where" condition calculated for splitting the table; if no <key> is provided, the tool will calculate a suitable key automatically.

Use
Enter the path to the "Split Rules File".

Use

Dependencies
  • Basic password policy:
    The master password must meet the following requirements:
    • It must be 10 to 30 characters long
    • It must contain at least one letter (a-z, A-Z)
    • It must contain at least one digit (0-9)
    • It must not contain \ (backslash) or " (double quote).
  • Additional restrictions depending on your operating system and database:
    • Windows:
      • If a user already exists, you are prompted to confirm the password for this user.
      • Depending on the configuration of the password policy, additional restrictions might apply.
    • IBM i:
      When you limit the password length on your IBM i host - for example by the system values QSECURITY,QPWDLVL, or QPWDMAXLEN - this can influence the maximum length of the SAP passwords. If you set QPWDMAXLEN to 10, then only a password length from 8 to 10 characters can be used. The recommended security level of 30 (set by system value QSECURITY) enables a maximum password length of 128 on the IBM i host. For more information, see section Checking and Adjusting Operating System Values in the installation guide.

    • HANA Database:
      The master password must meet the following additional requirements:
      • It must consist of at least one number, one lowercase letter, and one uppercase letter.
      • It can only contain the following characters: _, a-z, A-Z, 0-9, #, @, $, ! and must not start with a number or an underscore ( _ ).
  • Other restrictions:
    Depending on the installation option, additional restrictions might apply.

Definition
The SAP Java Virtual Machine (SAP JVM) is certified and fully compliant with the Java SE 5.0 standard.

Use
Features of the SAP JVM:
  • Shared Closures - The Shared Closure technology enables the fast movement of objects between Java Virtual Machine processes. It is semantically identical with Java serialization but provides much better performance. Shared Closures are used as the base technology for implementing fast session failover and therefore support the overall robustness of the application server.
  • Debugging on demand - With SAP JVM it is possible to switch a running system into debugging mode and vice-versa without the need to restart the virtual machine. This dramatically reduces the effort involved in tracing a problem in real-life scenarios because debugging is possible at any time and any place.
  • Profiling and Memory Debugging - The detection of performance and memory problems is just as important as the detection of functional errors. SAP JVM therefore offers capabilities in the area of performance and memory profiling that complement what is possible using a standard Java profiler.
  • Additional Supportability Features - In addition to the features already described in the area of supportability, SAP JVM offers features that ease the support of complex Java applications. The most prominent features are the extended stack trace, the provision of the values of local variables in exception stack traces, additional traces, help for the developer when solving problems and finding bugs (for example, garbage collection statistics), and many more.

Definition
The SAP system ID <SAPSID> is the identifier for the SAP system.

Use
Depending on the system provisioning option you are executing, consider the following:
  • If you install a new SAP system, enter the SAP system ID <SAPSID> for this system. If you install the instances of this system on more than one host, make sure that you assign the same <SAPSID> to all these instances. The identifier for the database instance - the database ID <DBSID> - can be different from the <SAPSID>.
  • If you add instances to an existing SAP system - for example, if you install additional application server instance(s) for an existing SAP system - enter the <SAPSID> of the existing SAP system.
  • If you uninstall an SAP system, enter the SAP system ID <SAPSID> of the SAP system you want to uninstall.
Dependencies
Choose your <SAPSID> carefully. Renaming is possible, but you must perform a system rename to achieve this.
Make sure that the <SAPSID> meets the following requirements:
  • It must be unique throughout your organization and consistent throughout your SAP system installation landscape.
    If you want to install an additional application server instance, make sure that no gateway instance with the same <SAPSID> exists in your SAP system landscape.
  • It must consist of exactly three alphanumeric characters.
  • Only uppercase letters are allowed.
  • The first character must be a letter (not a digit).
  • It must not be one of the IDs listed in SAP Note 1979280 because these IDs are reserved and cannot be used.

    Enter the SAP system ID <SAPSID> that should be created.The ID must be unique throughout your organization.
    It must consist of exactly three alphanumeric characters. Only uppercase letters are allowed. The first character must be a letter (not a digit).
    It must not include the IDs listed in SAP Note 1979280 because they are reserved and cannot be used.
    Make sure that no gateway instance with the same <SAPSID> exists in your SAP system landscape.
    Choose your SAP system ID carefully. Renaming is complicated and requires you to re-install the SAP system.

  • If you install an additional application server instance on the database host
    Make sure that the <SAPSID> is different from the Database ID <DBSID>. If it is not, the installation cannot continue.

Definition
Directory where the SAP system executables reside.

Use
The secure store is created during the database instance installation and contains information such as the host name, TCP port number, database user, and database password, which the application server requires to connect to the database server.

In a homogenous system landscape, where your SAP system runs on the same platform - for example, on Windows - Software Provisioning Manager on the database server (during the database instance installation) and the application servers (during operation) access the same directory.

If you have a heterogeneous installation where the database instance runs on UNIX and the application server runs on Windows, there might be system configurations where the database server processes cannot access the Windows file system directly. If so, the secure store directory is then created in a local directory (/sapmnt/<SAPSID>/global/security/data) on the UNIX database instance host. After the database instance installation has finished, you have to copy the secure store files manually from the UNIX host to the Windows file system.

Software Provisioning Manager cannot find the secure store files SecStore.properties and SecStore.key in the default directory \\sapglobalhost\sapmnt\<SAPSID>\SYS\global\security\data. You need to specify the location to which you previously copied the secure store files from the UNIX database host. Software Provisioning Manager then copies these files automatically to the default directory specified above.

Use
Decide which split strategy you want to use
  • (-top 50) Largest 50 tables in separate STR files
    Extracts the largest 50 tables in separate STR files (packages).
    You can enter another amount of largest tables in field Different value for the split strategy if required.
  • (-packages 1000) Packages not larger than 1000 MB
    Splits all packages not larger then 1000 MB in smaller packages.
    You can enter another size as 1000 MB in field Different value for the split strategy if required.
  • (-limit 300) Tables greater than 300 MB in separate STR
    Extract all tables with size more 300 MB in extra packages.
    You can enter another size as 300 MB in field Different value for the split strategy if required.
For more information, see the documentation System Copy for SAP Systems Based on SAP NetWeaver <Current_Version>.

If you choose Homogeneous System Copy, you copy or migrate an existing SAP system using the database-specific method.

For more information on the system copy methods, see the System Copy Guide for your SAP system.

Definition
Specifies the installation method.

Use
If you choose Standard System Copy / Migration (load-based), the system copy procedure uses an OS- and DB-independent export dump which has been created using the SAP tools to build up your target database. If you change your operating system or database, you need a migration key to import the data.

If you choose Homogeneous System Copy, you copy or migrate an existing SAP system using the database-specific method.

Definition
Specifies the installation method.

Use
If you choose Standard System Copy / Migration (load-based), the system copy procedure uses an OS- and DB-independent export dump which has been created using the SAP tools to build up your target database. If you change your operating system or database, you need a migration key to import the data.
If you choose Homogeneous System Copy (Backup/Restore), the system copy procedure uses an existing Oracle backup to build up your target database. The installation stops and asks you to restore the database manually after the database software has been installed. When you have finished, the installation performs some post-installation steps, for example, initializing the work bench, generating temporary license keys, consistency checks.
The operating system of the target host has to be the same as on the source host. With this option, you generate users and groups and the environment, if necessary.

For more information on the system copy methods, see the System Copy Guide for your SAP system.

Definition
Specifies the installation method.

Use
If you want to install a new database instance or if you want to install an additional SAP system into an already existing database instance (MCOD), choose Standard Installation.

If you choose Standard System Copy / Migration (load-based), the system copy procedure uses an OS- and DB-independent export dump which has been created using the SAP tools to build up your target database. If you change your operating system or database, you need a migration key to import the data.
If you choose System Copy / Migration Using Reload for Non-MCODSystems, the system reloads data into an existing target database.
Before reloading the data, the target database will be deleted.
Caution:
You must not use the reload option for MCOD systems. The reload service is only available for non-MCOD systems.
For more information on this method, see the documentation System Copy for SAP Systems Based on SAP NetWeaver <Current_Version>.

If you choose Homogeneous System Copy (Backup/Restore), the system copy procedure uses an existing Oracle backup to build up your target database.
The installation stops and asks you to restore the database manually after the database software has been installed. When you have finished, some post-installation steps will be performed, for example, initializing the work bench, generating temporary license keys, consistency checks.
The operating system of the target host has to be the same as on the source host. With this option, you generate users and groups and the environment, if necessary. For more information on this method, see the documentation System Copy for SAP Systems Based on SAP NetWeaver <Current_Version>.

Definition
Specifies the installation method.

If you choose Homogeneous System Copy, a custom data dump will be loaded. Choose this type of installation if you want to copy a customer system using the IBM Db2 for i-specific SAVLIB/RSTLIB method. For more information on this method, see the documentation System Copy for SAP Systems Based on SAP NetWeaver <Current_Version>.

Definition
The Transport Directory is used by SAP system transport tools like tp, R3trans to import and export changes of the SAP system.

Dependencies
With a central transport host you can set up a common transport directory for (almost) all the SAP systems in which you want to centrally manage your transports. Furthermore, you can simplify the maintenance of the transport directory by maintaining the directory at a central point.

The advantage of a central transport host is that you have to maintain only one central entry when moving the transport directory to another host, and not the parameters of each system.

Definition
To be able to transport changes between the SAP systems in your system landscape you need to configure the Transport Management System (TMS) for all SAP systems in your system landscape and configure one transport domain controller. To start the TMS in your ABAP system for later reconfiguration, call transaction STMS. At least one transport landscape with this system as transport domain controller is required before you can apply corrections, support packages or upgrades to the SAP system.

Dependencies
The name of the Transport Domain must not contain blank characters.
You cannot change the name afterwards without reconfiguring the transport domain controller and thereby the entire Transport Domain.

Use
By default use DOMAIN_<SAPSID> for the Transport Domain of a single transport landscape with this system as transport domain controller.

Definition
In order to be able to transport changes between the SAP systems in your system landscape you need to configure the Transport Management System (TMS) in all SAP systems in your system landscape and configure one transport domain controller. To start the TMS in your ABAP system later for reconfiguration, call transaction STMS. At least a single transport landscape with this system as transport domain controller is required before you can apply corrections, support packages or upgrades to the SAP system.

Use
By default use DOMAIN_<SAPSID> for the Transport Domain Description of a single transport landscape with this system as transport domain controller.

Definition
Location of the ABAP transport files that are to be included after the ABAP load during the installation.

Dependencies
All transport files in this directory are imported with the transport control program (tp).

Definition
With Force you overwrite any existing configuration settings in the ABAP Transport Management System (TMS) for this system.

Use
Use Force if you already configured the TMS and want to now overwrite the existing settings. Do not use it when you want to keep the existing TMS configuration settings of the SAP system.

Definition
ABAP client where the Java communication user exists.

Use

It is particularly not recommended if you want to deploy the SAP Enterprise Portal.
With this option, user management can be done with the SAPGUI transaction SU01 and depending on the permissions of your communication user also with the UME Web Admin and the Visual Administrator.
Group management can be done with the SAPGUI transaction PFCG .

Use
Suitable for all scenarios, except for SAP Exchange Infrastructure.
With this option, user management can be done with the SAPGUI transaction SU01 and depending on the permissions of your communication user also with the UME Web Admin and the Visual Administrator.
Group management can be done with UME Web Admin and the Visual Admin.

Definition
User configuration is performed by the User Management Engine (UME) Web Admin and the SAP NetWeaver Administrator only.

Use
Suitable for all scenarios except for SAP Exchange Infrastructure.

For more information about supported User Management Engine (UME) data sources and change options, see SAP Note 718383.
  • If you choose the option Use Java Database, user and groups exist within the database of the Java application server. Administrators use the identity management tool of the UME to manage users, groups, and roles.
  • If you choose the option Use External ABAP System, user and groups exist within the database of the external ABAP system. Administrators manage users with transaction SU01 in the external ABAP system. Depending on the permissions of the communication user, you can also use the identity management tool of the UME.
    Note: The administrator, guest, and communication users must exist in the external ABAP system before you can continue. For more information about how to create and name these users, see the installation guide.

Definition
The Use Java Tools option for managing user groups is suitable for all scenarios of the SAP system, except for Exchange Infrastrucutre (XI), and is a prerequisite for installing SAP Portal on this server.

Definition

Use
If you mark this checkbox, all parts of the SAP system with this SAP system ID (SAPSID) on this host are removed.
This includes:
  • All instances
  • The default profile
  • The directories of the SAP system

Dependencies
Do not mark this checkbox if you do not want to uninstall the complete SAP system with this SAPSID.
For example, do not mark this checkbox if you only want to uninstall an additional application server instance of an existing SAP system distributed over several hosts. Otherwise the contents of mounted global directories under /<sapmnt>/<SAPSID>/ , such as instance profiles and kernel executables, are also deleted.

Definition

  • If you want to uninstall the complete SAP system (all instances on all hosts), you can remove all domain and local users and groups.
  • If you want to uninstall single instances, for example, an additional application server on a separate host, only remove the local groups.

Use
If the virtual host name is provided, the instance is installed with the given name.
  • All application servers can use this virtual host name to connect to the instance.

The virtual host name used for the ASCS instance is also the SAP global host name, as the global files are located on the shared disk (CSD only).

Use
Choose a password for the webadm administration user. This user is created to use the web administration interface for Internet Communication Manager (ICM) and Web Dispatcher.

Dependencies
The Software Provisioning Manager sets the master password by default. If required, you can choose another password.
  • Basic password policy:
    The webadm password must meet the following requirements:
    • It must be 8 to 14 characters long.
    • It must contain at least one letter (a-z, A-Z).
    • It must contain at least one digit (0-9).
    • It must not contain \ (backslash) or " (double quote).

Use
The Encryption Mode represents the communication
between the Web Dispatcher and the back-end system (Profile parameter SSL_ENCRYPT).
For more information see the Additional Information and the SAP Web Dispatcher documentation
in the SAP Library.

Use
The HTTP port of the SAP Web Dispatcher is an entry point to the SAP system. The default is 80xx (where xx is the instance number).
For more information about HTTP, see the SAP Web Dispatcher documentation in the SAP Library at http://help.sap.com/netweaver -> <Release> -> Application Help -> Function-Oriented View -> Application Server -> Application Server Infrastructure -> Components of SAP NetWeaver Application Server -> SAP Web Dispatcher -> Administration of the SAP Web Dispatcher -> Configuration of the Web Dispatcher Server Port.

Use
The HTTPS port of the SAP Web Dispatcher is an entry point to the SAP system. The default is 443<xx> (where <xx> is the instance number).
For more information about HTTPS, see the SAP Web Dispatcher documentation in the SAP Library at http://help.sap.com/netweaver -> <Release> -> Application Help -> Function-Oriented View -> Application Server -> Application Server Infrastructure -> Components of SAP NetWeaver Application Server -> SAP Web Dispatcher -> Administration of the SAP Web Dispatcher -> Configuration of the Web Dispatcher Server Port.

Use
Standard configurations are available for:
  • 500 connections: test configuration, suitable for few concurrent requests
  • 2000 connections: configuration for small or medium-sized production systems
  • 32000 connections: configuration for large production systems and load tests
The configurations differ in the number of possible parallel connections and resource consumption, such as memory, sockets, and threads.

Use

area.name: DB2 for UNIX and Windows
TSA
area.item:
Definition
By default, the host name where the installation runs is displayed.

Use
-

Additional Information
To check the host name on each node, use the command "hostname -s".

Use
Enter the host name where the installation is not running.

Additional Information
To check the host name on each node, use the command "hostname -s".

Definition
The SAP software uses this IP address or its host name for all connections with the DB2 database. Ask your local Network Administrator for the correct IP address and subnet mask. This IP address must be a free IP address and should be registered with a new host name in the dns configuration. The cluster software automatically adds one high available IP address alias to one of the specified network interfaces. If the used network interface fails, the cluster software automatically moves the high available IP address to another network interface. If there is more than one network interface specified on the same node, the cluster software, if possible, first tries to move the IP address to another network interface on the same node.


Use
Enter the correct IP address.

Additional Information
The SAP software uses this IP address or its host name for all connections with the DB2 database.

Definition
Specify the subnet mask to be assigned for this IP address. Ask your local Network Administrator for the correct IP address and subnet mask. A commonly used subnet mask can look as follows: "255.255.255.0". If the specified high available IP address is from the same subnet as the network interfaces, specify the subnet mask from these network interfaces.

Use
Specify the subnet mask to be assigned to the high available IP address.

Additional Information
To check the subnet mask of the local network interfaces, use the command "ifconfig -a".

Definition
Cluster Configuration.
Specify if you want to generate cluster configration files for using your database in a clustered environment .

Definition
IBM Tivoli Systems Automation.
Specify if you want to install IBM Tivoli Systems Automation Software on your database server .

Definition
Network adapter (network interface) names that can be used for one high available IP address.
Samples for common used Ethernet network interface names are on Linux "eth0", "eth1" and on AIX "en0", "en1".
For each network interface it must be possible to host the IP address for the SAP - DB2 connection. Do not specify private network interfaces that cannot be reached from the SAP software.

Use
Enter the network adapter names that can be used for one high available IP address.

Additional Information:
To check on each local node the correct names, use the command "ifconfig -a".

Definition
For two node clusters, a tie breaker is required for the following reasons:
  • Without a tie breaker, the cluster software automates resources only if more than half of the nodes of a cluster are online. For a two node cluster without a tie breaker, this means that both nodes must be online for automation to be performed.
  • A tie breaker ensures that the cluster remains operational even when it is split in such a way that the communication between the two nodes fails.

Use
Specify an IP address that is outside the cluster, always available and can be contacted from all nodes of the cluster. The IP address should be in the same subnet as the specified network interfaces. You can use the network gateway of the specified network interfaces.

Additional Information:
To check the gateway of the local network interfaces, use the command "ifconfig -a".

Use
Specify if you want to add partitions to a Unicode SAP system .
If you have a non-Unicode SAP system, deselect this option .

Use
If you want to add new database partitions, enter the number of the additional partition.

Use
Add or remove additional database partitions.

Note:
Be aware that with physical partitioning you still have to perform installation steps on additional hosts.
For more information, see the installation documentation, section “Multi-Partition Installation”.

Dependencies:
The entries you make here will be used in the further process of the installation.
  • The entries you make here will be used in the further process of the installation.
  • UNIX only:
    The entries that are made here and others lateron are used for the creation of ".rhosts" and "db2nodes.cfg" files.

Definition
For an installation on DB2 for UNIX and Windows, the tablespaces are stored in the following directory structure:

  • UNIX:
    /db2/<SAPSID>/sapdata<n> or saptemp<n>
  • Windows:
    <drive>:\db2\<SAPSID>\sapdata<n> or saptemp<n>


Note:
Be aware that the first part, for example /db2/<SAPSID>/ is definite and you can only enter a value for sapdata<n> or saptemp<n>!

Use
Change, that is, add or remove the names and number of the sapdata and saptemp directories.
On the following dialogs you can assign the directories, which you entered here, to tablespace containers.

Definition
For an installation on DB2 for UNIX and Windows, the tablespaces are stored in the following directory structure:
  • With DB2's automatic storage management:
    Windows: <drive>:\db2\<DBSID>\sapdata1
    UNIX: /db2/<DBSID>/sapdata<n>
  • No automatic storage managment:
    Windows: <drive>:\db2\<SAPSID>\sapdata1
    UNIX: /db2/<SAPSID>/sapdata<n>
Note: Be aware that the first part, for example /db2/<SAPSID>/ is definite and you can only enter a value for sapdata<n>!

Use
Change, that is add or remove, the names and number of the sapdata and directories. If you add additional sapdata directories, the corresponding tablespace containers will be equally distributed.

Use
Assign the additional partitions to the correct host names.

Use
By choosing this option, all the tablespaces created are managed by DB2’s automatic storage management. For more information, see section DB2 Universal Database Tablespaces in the installation documentation.

Use
You can change the size of the displayed bufferpools.

If you are installing multiple components into one database (MCOD), you see the current size.

Caution!
Be aware that the page size cannot be changed.

Use
By choosing this option, the installation creates all required tablespaces for you.

Note:
If you want to create tablespaces manually, you must not select this option. The installation will then prompt you during the installation phase to create your tablespaces manually using the createTablespaces.clp script.

For more information see section DB2 Universal Database Tablespaces and Creating Tablespaces Manually in the installation documentation.

Use
Enter the required amount of database memory in MB.
With DB2 9, the installation updates the database configuration parameter DATABASE_MEMORY according to the value entered.
As of DB2 9.5 and higher, the installation updates the database manager configuration parameter INSTANCE_MEMORY according to the value entered and the database configuration parameter DATABASE_MEMORY is set to AUTOMATIC.

Use
If required, you can modify tablespace characteristics (for example, number of containers,
container size, page size, extent size, tablespace type).

Definition
By default, the DB2 software will be installed in directory C:\Program Files\IBM\SQLLIB.

Use
You can either keep the default path, change it manually or choose Browse to change the installation directory.

After the installation of the database software, all the database executables, libraries and JDBC driver are stored in this directory.

Use
Specify if you want to use the DB2 Administration Client Software or the DB2 Enterprise Server Edition. The DB2 Enterprise Server edition consists of the database server software including the Administration Client software.

Use
By choosing this option, DB2 Universal Database software will be removed from this computer.

Use
If you have exported your source system using R3load, your target system will be created from THIS export by choosing this option.

For more information, see the documentation for homogeneous and heterogenous system copy documentation.

Use
The installation proposes a default value.

The DB2 Communication Port is used for TCP/IP communication between the database server and remote DB2 clients.
You must make sure that the value is the same throughout your system landscape that uses THIS database instance.

Definition
SAP applications connect to the database with the database connect user.

Dependencies
For a new system installation, the installer proposes the following default names:
  • sap<sapsid> for ABAP systems
  • sap<sapsid>db for Java systems
If you change the name of the database connect user, the name must still conform to the pattern sapxxx (for ABAP) and sapxxxdb (for Java), where xxx can be replaced by any alphanumeric characters. Please use lower case characters.

Recommendations
For a new system installation, we recommend that you keep the proposed default values.
In all other cases, make sure that the name of the database connect user corresponds to the value in your system. If necessary, adapt it to your system settings.

We also recommend that you keep the name of the connect user identical to the name of the database schema in standard use cases. The exception to this rule, for example, is a system copy using database means, where DB2 is not able to change the schema name.

Use
You can assign the displayed node groups to a database partition.

Definition

  • sap<sapsid>db for Java systems
If you change the name of the database schema, the name must still conform to the pattern sapxxx (for ABAP) and sapxxxdb (for Java), where xxx can be replaced by any alphanumeric characters.

Definition
The database partition servers communicate using registered services. During the installation a port range is assigned for this communication.

Use
The installation proposes default values. You must make sure that these values correspond to the values of your database partition servers. If necessary, adapt them according to your settings.

Dependencies
  • The value for First Port must be the same for all database partition servers.
  • The range between First Port and Last Port must correspond to the maximum number of partitions on a database partition server.

Example
You are using three database partition servers. The first and the second database partition server hold three partitions each.
The third one holds four partitions. This means, the range between First Port and Last Port must be four.

Members of this group have DB2 SYSADM authorities. By default, user db2<dbsid> is a member of this group.

If you are installing an additional Java application server instance on a host where no other instance
(for example, a database, central or additional application server instance of an ABAP component) is installed, the JDBC driver files d2jcc.jar and db2jcc_license_cu_jar)
are not available on the additional application server instance host. Therefore you must provide the JDBC driver files from the database server
using a network share. Thus, you make sure that always the correct versions of the JDBC driver files are used.

For more information, see the installation documentation, section "Location of the JDBC Driver Files".

Definition
The database partition servers communicate using registered services. During the installation a port range is assigned for this communication.
Use
The installation proposes default values. You must make sure that these values correspond to the values of your database partition servers. If necessary, adapt them according to your settings.

Dependencies
  • The value for Last Port must be the same for all database partition servers.
  • The range between First Port and Last Port must correspond to the maximum number of partitions on a database partition server.

Example
You are using three database partition servers. The first and the second database partition server hold three partitions each.
The third one holds four partitions. This means, the range between First Port and Last Port must be four.

"MCOD Tablespaces and Directories" (Windows).
