If you choose to perform a backup check, the SAP HANA operating system administrator user and password are prompted in the next screen.

Definition
The location of the SAP HANA installation export medium or files (new system installation), or the location of the SAP HANA database backup (system copy)

Use
The directory entered as the installation export location is searched for SAP HANA installation export files (new system installation), or the directory entered as the backup location is searched for SAP HANA database backup files (system copy).

Dependencies
For an installation export (new system installation) or database backup (system copy), you also must specify a prefix or name.

Definition
The location where the SAP HANA installation export (new system installation), or database backup (system copy) can be accessed by the database server

Use
The directory you enter here must be accessible for the SAP HANA database and readable for the administrator user of the database operating system .

Dependencies
If you choose to perform an installation export check (new system installation) or a backup check (system copy), the SAP HANA operating system administrator user and password will be requested in the next screen.

Definition
The prefix or name of an SAP HANA installation export (new system installation), or SAP HANA database backup (system copy)

Use
If there is more than one installation export (new system installation) or database backup (system copy), the prefix is used to identify the installation export (new system installation) or the database backup (system copy) to be recovered.

Dependencies
You also must specify the location of the installation export (new system installation) or database backup (system copy).

Definition
Database load option selection

Use
Select if the database will be loaded manually from a database backup or if the database is already loaded.

Dependencies
When selecting manual backup load, the password for the database administration is also needed. The installer will indicate when to execute the manual backup recovery.
When selecting data is already loaded, Software Provisioning Manager (SWPM) will continue without any further backup request.

Definition
Database parameters to be used during the execution of the SAP HANA backup.

Use
Enter any parameter to be used during the backup execution.

Dependencies
The parameters will be set for the tenant to backed up.

Definition
Enter the desired hostname(s) to be used for the database connection user store.

Use
Leave the field empty to allow the Software Provisioning Manager to configure the database connection using the public hostname(s) found in the SAP HANA database.

Dependencies
This is an advanced feature and normally does not need modification. Special scenarios where the public HANA hostname cannot be resolved from the ABAP host might require this property to be set.

Example
Example for a list of one or more valid database hostnames: <host1>[,<host2>]

Use
Do not check the checkbox to drop the DBACOCKPIT user if the user is also used by other systems.
  • If the schema name is DBACOCKPIT<SID>, it is usually safe to drop it.
  • If the schema name is DBACOCKPIT (without the SID), it should generally not be dropped since other systems might be using it.

Definition
Drops the database schema

Use
Select this option to drop the database schema.

Definition
The list of database schemas for which you can change the password.

Use
Select the database schemas for which you want to change the password.

You can also choose one schema for which the name and password are stored in the SAP HANA user store. This schema is used for the primary database connection.

Definition
The location to which the SAP HANA database backup is to be extracted.

Use
The directory entered will be used to extract the SAP backup files. This directory needs to be accessible from both the SAP system and the SAP HANA hosts.

Dependencies
The directory must exists and Software Provisioning Manager must have write access to it. The access from the SAP HANA host must be at least readable by the database operating system administrator user.

Definition
The folder name to be used to store the HANA user store (hdbuserstore) files.

Use
When left empty, the hdbuserstore will create a folder with the current hostname in the home directory to store its files. In distributed scenarios, using a specific name will allow to share the folder between multiple hosts.

Dependencies
Used only for hdbuserstore. Only letters, '-' and '_' are allowed.

Definition
SAP HANA database parameters to be set before the import starts

Use
The import can be optimized by setting SAP HANA parameters. The exact parameters to be set depend on the individual situation. The default parameters are a best-practice suggestion that is useful in most scenarios.

Dependencies
Parameters where the check box Keep After Import is selected are preserved after the import has completed. All other parameters are reset to the state they had before the import.

Definition
Initialize the database topology

Use
If you want to completely remove all data from the database - only the data, not the configuration, you can choose to initialize the database topology. In a test scenario, this can improve the database performance compared to only dropping the schema.

Dependencies
Caution: Only choose to initialize the topology if there is no other content in the database. Initializing the topology deletes all content - other schemas, users, and SAP HANA content - that might be present.

Use
The default value corresponds to the number of archives found. Only change this number if you have special requirements.

Definition
The location of a file containing check procedures for the SAP HANA landscape reorg

Use
For more information see SAP Note 1958346.

Definition
The result of the SAP HANA landscape reorg check

Use
The result of the SAP HANA landscape reorg check is displayed here. Check for errors or warnings and correct any errors before continuing.

Dependencies
Ignoring errors or warnings might lead to a non-functioning system or degraded performance.

Definition
Show the result of the SAP HANA landscape reorg checks even if the checks are successful

Use
If selected, the screens of the SAP HANA landscape reorg checks are shown if the checks were successful. If not selected, the screens are only displayed if errors or warnings occurred.

Definition
A file containing parameters for the SAP HANA landscape reorg

Use
For more information, see SAP Note 1900822.

Definition
The path to a valid SAP HANA database license

Use
A new SAP HANA license might be required when performing a system copy via backup / recovery if the backup is recovered on a different database.

Definition
Migration data will be loaded manually.

Use
Leave unchecked for Software Provisioning Manager (SWPM) to request and validate additional information and execute a default migration. Only select this option if you want to manually execute a database recovery.

Dependencies
When using backup/recovery method, the backup files must be accessible from the database host.

Use
Choose Recreate Database Tenant only if you have decided to delete all content of the database tenant including all users, schemas, and roles. In addition, the tenant specific configuration is initialized.
Choose this option if you are doing a reinstall or a refresh of the system. The advantage of recreating the tenant database compared to 'drop user' is that all data is instantly deleted, which leads to better performance during data import. Recreate Tenant Database is only available for system copy.

Definition
The URL of the SAPControl web service of an SAP HANA database

Use
The SAPControl web service is used to perform OS-level operations on the SAP HANA database server.

Example
The syntax of the SAPControl URL is as follows: http://<dbhost>:5<instance number>13/SAPControl?wsdl

Definition
Do not check if an SAP HANA database backup exists.

Use
Mark this checkbox to skip the check if an SAP HANA database backup exists. This can be useful, for example, if there is no database backup available, or if the check fails.

Dependencies
If the check is skipped, you must make sure that the database backup is at the specified location during the Execute Service phase. Otherwise, the installation fails.

Definition
The system ID of the source database

Definition
Path to the server's public key certificate or Personal Security Environment (.pse file) that contains it.

Use
The public certificate can be exported from the SAP HANA database using sapgenpse.

Dependencies
The path to the public server root certificate is required if certificate validation is selected.

Definition
Host name used to verify server’s identity

Use
If the name in the certificate does not match the host name used for the connection, the host name specified here is used to verify the identity of the server instead.
Leave this field empty if the host name matches. Enter the host name in the certificate or enter '*' to skip validation.

Definition
Enable database server certificate validation

Use
Set this checkbox to enable validation for the SAP HANA database server's certificate.

Dependencies
If selected, the server root has to be provided and the host name might need to be supplied as well. A .pse file containing the server's certificate is also valid.

Definition
The password for the SYSTEM user for the tenant database to be used in the recovery process.

Definition
Select the user store technology to store your ABAP user credentials for your SAP Systems on HANA.
  • hdbuserstore - SAP HANA specific store
  • ABAP SSFS - Database independent secure store
Use
The selected secure store will be used to store the ABAP credentials for your SAP System. For more information, see SAP 1639578.

Dependencies
The HANA user store will be created in the home directory of the <sapsid>adm user. The ABAP SSFS store is created in the SAPGLOBAL directory.

Definition
Enables or disables TLS/SSL data encryption

Use
Set this checkbox for Software Provisioning Manager to configure the SAP systems to use encryption for SAP HANA database connections.

Dependencies
If selected for ABAP systems, additional server certification validation can be set for the SAP System at a later step.

area.name: IBM DB2 for i5/OS
area.item:
Use
Enter the auxiliary storage pool (ASP) number for the database library to be used by your SAP system. Accepted values from 1 to 255.
For more information, see Distribution of Libraries on ASPs in the installation documentation.

Caution:
The ASP has to exist on your system. If you enter a number of an independent ASP make sure its status is AVAILABLE. The system will be configured according to SAP Note 568820.

Use
Decide if you want to check the current PTF level of your machine against the IBM INFOAPAR. If no INFOAPAR can be found or the check fails, a dialog is displayed. You can continue the installation then but you should apply all required PTFs and possibly check the PTF level manually.

Use
The device from which to restore, e.g. TAP01.

Use
The SID of the system you copied from.

Use
Used to restore your saved database library.

Use
Choose whether you want to restore from a device or whether you want to use a savefile to restore.

Use
The name of the savefile of the original system.
Only valid when restoring a savefile.

Use
The library where the savefile resides.
Only valid when restoring a savefile.

Use
Choose whether you want to copy the existing INFOAPAR or whether you want to use the existing INOFAPAR.

Dependencies
If you choose to copy the existing INFOAPAR, the installation copies the INFOAPAR from the kernel media into the directory /usr/sap/trans/config. This will overwrite an already existing INFOAPAR in this directory.

If you choose to use the existing INFOAPAR, the installation uses the existing INFOAPAR which is located in the directory /usr/sap/trans/config.

Use
Enter the auxiliary storage pool (ASP) number for the database library to be used by your SAP system. Accepted values from 1 to 255.
For more information, see Distribution of Libraries on ASPs in the installation documentation.

Caution:
The ASP has to exist on your system. If you enter a number of an independent ASP make sure its status is AVAILABLE. The system will be configured according to SAP Note 568820.

Use
Choose the library location.

Loading a new kernel library from media:
This option is recommended.
Caution: Any existing library is overwritten.

Using existing library:
If you select this option, the installation uses the entered library as the kernel library. It is possible to share a kernel library between systems but we do not recommend it. This is because making changes in a shared kernel library for one SAP system could inadvertently influence the other SAP systems that use this library.
Caution: You have to specify a valid SAP kernel library, otherwise this installation will fail.

Use
Enter the user auxiliary storage pool (ASP) number for the kernel library SAP<SAPSID>IND. Values from 1 to 32.
For more information, see Distribution of Libraries on ASPs in the installation documentation.

Caution:
The ASP has to exist on your system.

Use
Specify the name of the native objects library, for example, SAP<SAPSID>I<nn>. A new library with this name will be generated or overwritten if necessary.

Use
Specify the name of the kernel library, for example, SAP<SAPSID>IND. A new library with this name will be generated or overwritten if necessary.
Note:
This prompt only appears if you are installing the first instance of an SAP system on a host.

Use
Recommended option that loads the native objects library from the media (ILE_TOOLS).

Caution:
An existing library is overwritten.

Use
Select this option if you want the installer to link the transport directory to the primary application server instance. This link is using QFileSvr.400. If you do not select this option, you have to adjust the link /usr/sap/trans manually, if necessary.

Caution:
If you select this option, your /usr/sap/trans will be modified. This could be dangerous if you already have SAP systems installed on the host.

Use
Choose whether you want to use the native or the Toolbox JDBC driver for the Java Engine and SDM.

Definition
The native JDBC driver is useful for a local environment.
If you select Native Driver, the native JDBC driver will be used by the Java Engine and SDM.
If you select Toolbox Driver, the Toolbox JDBC driver will be used by the Java Engine and SDM.

Caution:
The native JDBC driver will not work for a remote additional application server instance.

Caution:
We do not recommend using the Toolbox and native JDBC driver in parallel to get access to the database as this has not been tested yet.

Use
Enter or confirm the directory where your toolbox driver is located. You have to enter the directory where the corresponding file jt400.jar is located. Do not enter the complete path to the file itself. For more information, see Choosing a JDBC Driver in the installation documentation.

Use
Enter your SAP code page, for example, in Western Europe and North America (wherever LATIN-1 is used) enter for non-Unicode 1100 or for Unicode enter 4102.

Use
If your primary language on IBM i is not English, enter an English secondary language library.
This language library is used by the SAP support. For example, enter QSYS2924. For more information, see Installing English as a Secondary Language in the installation documentation.

Use
If you select this option, the library named above is used as the library that contains native executables for Java. It is possible to share the Java native executables between instances. However, we do not recommend this because making changes in a shared library for one instance could inadvertantly influence the other instances that use this library.

Caution:
You have to specify a valid Java library, otherwise this installation will fail.

area.name: Informix
area.item:
Definition
The port number for the Informix database.

Use
Enter the database port number.

Dependencies
The /etc/services file contains an entry for each service availble through TCP/IP.
Each entry is a single line that contains a service name and a port number.
The name of the service is sapinf (SAPSID) and the port number is arbitrary.
However, they must be unique within the context of the file and must be identical on all computers that are running Informix client-server products.

Definition
Name of SAP dbspace

Definition
Default size of SAP dbspaces in KB

Definition
Drive name for SAP dbspaces

Use
If required, change the drive name of the dbspaces.

Example
C:

Definition
Maximum size allowed for raw device links (UNIX) or drives (Windows) for SAP dbspaces in KB

Use
View the maximum size allowed for individual raw device links or drives comprising the dbspaces.
If the total size needed exceeds the maximum size allowed, go back and change the dbspace allocation.

Definition
Raw device links (UNIX) or drives (Windows) for SAP dbspaces.

Use
Check the individual raw device links or drives for the dbspaces.
If required, change a link or drive.

Dependencies
UNIX (except Linux): The raw device link must exist. If required, create the link yourself.

Definition
Size of SAP dbspaces in KB

Use
If required, change the dbspace sizes. You might need to go back to a previous screen to do this.
Windows only: if you delete the size entry for a mirror dbspace, the mirror dbspace is not created.

Dependencies
The dbspaces must be:
  • At least 1000 KB
  • At least the default dbspace size
  • A multiple of 4 KB

Definition
Size of raw device links or directories for SAP dbspaces in the Informix database in KB

Use
If required, change the size of individual raw device links or directories comprising the dbspaces.

Definition
Total size needed for raw device links (UNIX) or drive (Windows) for SAP dbspaces in KB

Use
View the total size needed for individual raw device links or drives comprising the dbspaces.
If the total size needed exceeds the maximum size allowed, go back and change the dbspace allocation.

Definition
The operating system user informix, which is the database server administrator.

Definition
The operating system user sapr3, which is the internal database user for SAP instances to connect to the database.

Definition
Instance number of the Informix Dynamic Server (IDS)

Use
Specify the IDS instance number.

Dependencies
The IDS instance number must be:
  • A unique integer between 0 and 255 for each database server instance
  • Unique for each database server on your local computer but not necessarily unique across your network

Definition
The name of the Informix directory.
Before the installation can install an Informix product, it needs to create a directory and to set the INFORMIXDIR environment variable.
INFORMIXDIR specifies the directory where the Informix product files are installed.
A database server must be installed in the same directory as any local client products that use it.

Definition
The name of the Informix SQL host (Windows) or the name of the sqlhosts file (UNIX)

Use
Enter the name of the host where the Informix database instance runs (Windows) or the name of the sqlhosts file (UNIX).
Normally accept the value shown.

Dependencies
  • On UNIX platforms, the sqlhosts file contains connectivity information that allows an Informix client application to connect to any Informix database server on the network.
  • On Windows platforms, the sqlhosts entry in the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE registry contains the same connectivity information.
In both cases, the sqlhosts data for a particular database server includes the database server name, the type of connection a client can use to connect to it, the name of the host computer or node on which it runs, and the service name by which it is known.

Definition
Installation of Informix client software

Use
The client software will be installed by default.
Deselect if you do not want to install the client software.

Definition
Instance number of the Informix Dynamic Server (IDS) on the existing node (node A) of Microsoft Failover Cluster (MSFC)

Use
Specify the IDS Instance number from the unclustered IDS server on node A.

Dependencies
Make sure that you enter the value of the instance number using the minimum number of characters.
You must not enter a leading 0. You must enter 0 as 0, not as 00.

Definition
Shared drives of the dbspaces for Informix with Microsoft Failover Cluster (MSFC)

Use
You can use up to eight shared drives to distribute your dbspaces.
For each shared drive, enable the field by selecting Drive <n> available and enter the name of the shared drive that you used for your chunks.

Dependencies
The values you enter must exactly match the names of the drives in the cluster administrator.
Check the cluster administrator to make sure.

Definition
Number of CPU virtual processors.
CPU virtual processors run threads resulting from a connection by a client application, as well as internal threads.
Do not allocate more CPU virtual processors than there are physical CPUs on the host machine.

Use
Specify the number of virtual processors.

Dependencies
We recommend the following settings:
If you have only one physical CPU, specify one CPU virtual processor.
If you have more than one physical CPU on the host:
Number of CPU virtual processors = number of physical CPUs - 1

Example
  • If you have 1 physical CPU, specify the number of virtual processors as 1
  • If you have 2 physical CPUs, specify the number of virtual processors as 1
  • If you have 4 physical CPUs, specify the number of virtual processors as 3

Definition
Existing Informix raw device links valid for this database instance

Definition
Size of Informix raw device links in bytes

Use
Check whether the raw device sizes are correct.
If the values displayed differ from the actual sizes, correct the sizes here.

Definition
Skips update statistics for Informix

Use
Select this option to skip update statistics for Informix..

Definition
Updates Informix statistics

Use
Select this option to update the Informix statistics.

area.name: MaxDB
liveCache
area.item:
Definition
Name of the SAP liveCache host

Use
Enter the name of the host where SAP liveCache is to be installed.

Definition
Database instance ID for SAP liveCache

Use
Enter the SAP liveCache instance ID.

Definition
Memory in MB for the SAP liveCache in MB

Use
Enter the size of the SAP liveCache memory in MB.

Dependencies
  • The SAP liveCache memory must be large enough to accommodate all SAP liveCache data from disk.
  • Half of the value that you enter is used for the database cache, the other half is used for the SAP liveCache heap.
  • The minimum value for the SAP liveCache memory is 200 MB.
  • The value of the liveCache memory is important for the definition of the sizes of the database data volumes. If you plan to increase the memory usage of the SAP liveCache instance after installation, you must make sure that the size of the SAP liveCache data volumes is greater than the SAP liveCache memory requirement.
  • If you want to install additional SAP products in this database instance - for example, SCM OneDB - you must allow additional SAP liveCache memory.

Definition
SAP liveCache user name

Use
Enter the SAP liveCache user name.

Dependencies
The SAP liveCache user defines the database schema for the SAP liveCache application.
The application data are stored in the SAP liveCache database schema.

Definition
SAP liveCache and the MaxDB database are installed in a single database with separate database users

Use
Select this option to install a SAP liveCache OneDB system. The installation tool installs SAP MaxDB and SAP liveCache at the same time in a single database.
If you do not select this field, SAP liveCache and SAP MaxDB are different databases, which means that you must install SAP liveCache separately.

Definition
Password for the SAP liveCache database user

Use
Enter a password for the SAP liveCache database user.

Dependencies
The password can only contain letters (A to Z in uppercase or lowercase) or numbers (0 to 9).
Special characters are not allowed because they cause an installation error.
After installation you can only change the password using database tools.

Definition
Database schema of the source SAP liveCache, which is the SAP liveCache where the backup came from

Use
Enter the name of the source SAP liveCache schema.

Definition
Specifies whether SAP liveCache is to be installed for a Unicode SCM system

Use
Select this option to install SAP liveCache for a Unicode SCM system.

Definition
Specifies whether Advanced Windowing Extensions (AWE) is used

Use
Select this to use AWE.

Use
Specify whether you want to use SAP liveCache for your SAP system.

Definition
Enable Data Area Extension

Use
It is enough to specify one data volume when you activate automatic extension.The system adds new volume when the data area exceeds 90% of the fill level.

Definition
Name of the physical backup

Use
Enter the name of the physical backup without path.

Dependencies
Part of the backup medium definition

Example
DataBackup

Definition
Path of the physical backup

Use
Enter the absolute path of the physical backup.

Dependencies
Part of the backup medium definition

Example
Windows: C:\temp
Unix: /tmp/BackupFolder

Definition
Type of backup template

Use
Select the type of the backup template.

Dependencies
Part of the backup medium definition

Example
FILE

Use
Choose whether you want to recreate the existing database instance for the new SAP system installation or whether you want to install an SAP system into an existing database instance.

Dependencies
If you choose to recreate the existing database instance for the new SAP system installation, the existing database instance is deleted and then recreated.
Always use this option except if you want to set up Multiple Components on One Database (MCOD).

If you choose to use the existing database instance, you install the new SAP system into an existing database instance for Multiple Components on One Database (MCOD).
If you select this option for MCOD, make sure that you have an up-to-date database backup and sufficient disk space before you continue.

Use
Choose whether you want to recreate the existing database schema for the new SAP system installation or whether you want to install an SAP system into an existing database schema.

Dependencies
If you choose to recreate the existing database schema for the new SAP system installation, the existing database schema is deleted and then recreated.
If you choose to use the existing database schema , you install the new SAP system into an existing database schema.

Definition
Select the volume medium type for the MaxDB database.

Use
Choose whether you want to set up the volumes on a file system or on raw devices.

Definition
Number of CPUs used concurrently

Use
Select the number of CPUs used concurrently.

Definition
Maximum number of concurrent database connections.
The number of concurrent database connections is defined by the database parameter MAXUSERTASKS.
On the ABAP stack each process (dialog process, batch process, update process, and spool process) of both the primary and the additional application server instances requires a separate database connection.
On the Java stack the number of database connections per primary and additional application server instance is defined by the database pool. The initial configuration of the database pool is configured with 10 connections to the database for each primary and additional application server instance.
The subsequent modification of the database parameter MAXUSERTASKS requires the restart of the database.
Each database connection requires its own memory. Memory usage depends on the operating system and requires between 512 and 1500 kB per database connection. The actual value is stored in the database parameter _MAXTASK_STACK.

Example
A system consists of:
  • Primary application server instance with 20 dialog processes, 3 batch processes, 2 update processes, and 2 spool processes
  • Additional application server instance with 20 dialog processes and 3 batch processes
  • Java AddIn with initial configuration of 10 maximum database connections in the database poo
For this configuration you need 27 connections for the primary application server instance, 23 connections for the additional application server instance, and 10 connections for the Java AddIn. For this example, enter at least 60 for the number of database sessions.

Use
Choose whether you want the system to create the MaxDB statistics automatically or whether you want to skip this step and create the MaxDB statistics manually.

Definition
Name of the group to which the database software owner belongs

Definition
Database manager operator, with rights to perform various functions of the Database Manager (DBM) tool

Dependencies
The DBM stores the name and password of the DBM operators in uppercase. There are no special characters. The default name of the database manager operator is control.

Dialog sdb_sdbuninst in der Datei s_sapdb_remove.xml

Definition
<What is this field for? What does this field mean?>

Use
<What happens when I enter a value or set an flag? Under what circumstances do I use the field? What do I enter in this field and why (no specific values)?>

Dependencies
<What other fields or functions does this field influence? Are there other effects that I might not expect? Are there restrictions? >

Example
<Is this field has a certain value or setting, what happens?>

Definition
Database system administrator, set up when the database instance is created

Dependencies
The default name of the database system administrator is superdba.

Definition
Drive for the data, configuration files, and run directories of the database instance and database applications

Use
Enter the required drive.

Dependencies
Windows only.
The directory is <drive>:\sapdb\DBID\data.

Definition
Drive for the server software that depends on the database version

Use
Enter the required drive.

Dependencies
Windows only.
The directory is <drive>:\sapdb\<DBSID>\db.
Multiple directories with different versions can exist together.

Definition
Path and name of the physical backup

Use
Enter the absolute path and the name of the physical backup.

Dependencies
Part of the backup medium definition

Example
C:/temp/C11Datasave, /tmp/BackupFolder/C11Datasave

Definition
Drops the whole database

Use
Select this option to drop the whole database.

Definition
Drops the database schema

Use
Select this option to drop the database schema.

Definition
MaxDB autoextend feature

Use
Select this option to enable the autoextend feature, which automatically enlarges the database when the amount of data exceeds 90%.

Definition
Shows the size of the free space in the data volumes for the new data

Use
Check that there is enough free space in the data volumes.

Dependencies
This applies when you are installing an additional SAP system into an existing database instance as part of Multiple Components in One Database (MCOD).

Definition
Freespace check

Use
If you select this field, the installation tool transfers the database instance to the ONLINE operational state and checks if the required freespace in the backup folder is available. The installation tool transfers the database instance back to the ADMIN operational state if the check has finished sucessfully.

Definition
Port address of the web server, required for MaxDB web tools

Use
Enter the port address of the web server.

Dependencies
You can call web tools that use the web server as follows:
  • Web Database Manager (Web DBM) with http://<web_server>:<port>/webdbm
  • Web SQL Studio with http://<web_server>:<port>/websql

Definition
Drive for the data, configuration files, and run directories of database instances and database applications

Use
Enter the required drive.

Dependencies
Windows only.
The directory is <drive>:\sapdb\data.

Definition
Drive for the programs and libraries shared by the database instances and database applications

Use
Enter the required drive.

Dependencies
Windows only.
The directory is <drive>:\sapdb\programs.

Definition
Size of I/O buffer cache in MB

Use
Enter the size of the I/O buffer cache in MB.

Definition
Loads the data for the new system into the existing database with deactivated redo log management

Use
Select this option to load the data with deactivated redo log management.

Dependencies
With deactivated redo log management:
  • You must manage the log backups, otherwise the log fills up and the database stops working.
  • If there is a database crash during the load, all transactions are lost and you must restart the load from the beginning.
  • You must end all database sessions before the load starts.
  • Caution: after the load has finished, you must reactivate redo log management and perform a full database backup.

Definition
Loads the data for the new system into the existing database with activated redo log management

Use
Select this option to load the data with activated redo log management.

Dependencies
With activated redo log management:
  • You must manage the log backups, otherwise the log fills up and the database stops working.
  • The load process takes longer.
  • The database can be used by other applications without data loss.

Definition
Manual restore or automatic restore

Use
If you select this field, Software Provisioning Manager stops and you can perform the restore manually.
When the restore is finished you can continue with Software Provisioning Manager.
If you do not select this field, Software Provisioning Manager starts and perform the restore of the database.

Dependencies
Use the manual restore when you want to restore the database with a backup medium type other than a file.

Definition
Name of the backup template

Use
Enter a name of your choice.

During backups, the data or log entries are saved to a data carrier, such as a tape or a file in the file system.

Before you can back up data and log entries to a data carrier, you have to define a backup template. In the properties of the backup template you specify, among other things, the backup type and the type of data carrier to be used. You can use the same backup template more than once. The

Dependencies
Part of backup template definition.

Example
"MigrationTemplate"

Definition
Mirroring of the log volumes

Use

Definition
Activate Secure Storage in Filesystem (AS ABAP).

The secure storage in the file system is part of SAP NetWeaver Application Server (AS) ABAP. The Software Provisioning Manager, AS ABAP kernel, and AS ABAP tools that connect to the database can use this storage to securely store connection-relevant data like passwords and other data that are relevant for secure operation. The encrypted storage of the data prevents unauthorized persons or programs being able to access this data.

For more information see SAP Note SAP Note 1639578.

Dependencies
The database schema is one of the following:
  • The ABAP database schema is SAP<SCHEMA_ID> (or SAPR3 for older SAP systems).
    Default name is SAPSR3.
  • The Java database schema is SAP<SCHEMA_ID>DB.
    Default name is SAPSR3DB.
Make sure that the <SCHEMA_ID> consists of three alphanumeric characters in uppercase.

We recommend that you choose a database schema ID (<SCHEMA_ID>) that is different from your SAP system ID (<SAPSID>).
It might cause problems when you copy a system where <SCHEMA_ID> is the same as <SAPSID>, and the database-specific method used for the copy does not allow you to rename the database schemas. In certain situations, you might create a system copy with a new <SAPSID>, but where the database schema has the old <SAPSID>. This is not a technical problem, but might cause confusion.

Caution:
Before deleting any database schema and tablespaces, make sure that:
  • You have performed a recent offline database backup.
  • You have stopped or deleted all SAP instances belonging to this database schema.
  • If you have installed a Java system, you have stopped the AS Java with transaction SMICM.
  • You only delete the tablespaces that belong to the selected schema.
    For example, if you want to remove one schema from an SAP system that is running with other systems in one database (MCOD), only remove the tablespaces that belong to this schema.

Definition

Use
The multitenant option introduced in Oracle Database 12c allows a single container database (CDB) to host multiple separate pluggable databases (PDB).

Container Database (CDB)
The container database is the body of a seed and a pluggable (PDB) database and is called CDB$ROOT. In this special database the common user, SGA, control file, and more are stored.
Every CDB has a seed database. This seed is the template for creating additional PDBs. The seed database has the internal name PDB$SEED.

Pluggable Database (PDB)
The pluggable database includes the customer data, for SAP the SAP<SCHEMAID> data. Every PDB shares the SGA, control file, redo logs and undo tablespace from the CDB. Every PDB has its own system and sysaux tablespace and can have its own temporary tablespace.

Use
  • doPLSQLSplit: Tables will be split with the oracle specific PL/SQL splitter tool

    For more information, see SAP Note 1043380.

Use
In Oracle Database 12c, several new features have been added to the Oracle Advanced Compression option that enhance the storage management capabilities of the Oracle database. Automatic Data Optimization (ADO) automatically moves and compresses data based on the information collected by the Heat Map. Together, these capabilities help to implement Information Lifecycle Management (ILM) strategies.
With this policy you can set row store compression at tablespace level after <x> days.

Definition
This entry is written to the java secure store entry jdbc/pool/<SID>/Url. The default value is
jdbc:oracle:thin@<dbHost>:<port>:<dbSid>. For Oracle RAC installation you need an EZCONNECT entry like
jdbc:oracle:thin@//<scan listener address>/<service_name>.

For more information see the Oracle white paper Configuration of SAP NetWeaver for Oracle Grid Infrastructure 11.2.0.2 and Oracle Real Application Clusters 11g Release 2 at http://scn.sap.com/community/oracle.

Example
jdbc:oracle:thin@//lu-scan/C11

Definition
Specify which service name is preferred to connect to which oracle RAC cluster node (option -r <SID><threadnr>)

Use
srvctl add service -d <SID> -s <serviceName> -r <SID><thread1> -a <SID><thread2>, <SID><thread3,.. -P -e -z -m

Example
DB_SID = C11
Instance Name = D01
Service Name = C11_D01
Cluster Nodes = C11001, C11002, C11003
Preferred Service Name = C11001
srvctl add service -d C11 -s C11_D01 -r C11001 -a C11002, C11003 -P BASIC -y AUTOMATIC -q true -j long -e SELECT -m BASIC -z 3 -w 5
srvctl start service -d C11 -s C11_D01

Definition
The SCAN listener is configured during the installation of the Oracle Grid Infrastructure.

Use
Use srvctl config scan to get the configured SCAN listener name. This value is also set for parameter remote_listener in initSID.ora.

Example
srvctl config scan returns:

SCAN name: lu-scan, Network: 1/10.20.88.0/255.255.252.0/eth0
SCAN VIP name: scan1, IP: /lu-scan/10.20.91.124

Therefore, the SCAN Listener is lu-scan.

Definition
Software Provisioning Manager creates the shell script <ServiceName>.sh in the installation directory

Use
Copy the shell scipt for example C11_D01.sh to your database host and execute this scipt while logged in as the oracle user.

Definition
The Service Name is added in the tnsnames.ora for client connection to the cluster database service.

Example
Service Names for an SAP System C11:
For the primary application server instance, the Service Name is C11_DVEBMGS00.
For an additional application server instance, the Service Name is C11_D01.

Use
Enter the number of Oracle database instances running on two or more clustered machines.

Dependencies
The maximum number of cluster machines Software Provisioning Manager can configure is 9.

Definition
Enter the length of the instance number: The default is 3.

Example
Length of instance number = 3: SID001, SID002, SID003,... , SID009.
Length of instance number = 1: SID1, SID2, SID3, ... , SID9.

Use
Enter the Instance Number of the local RAC instance.

Dependencies
The maximum number of cluster machines SAPInst can configure is 9.

Definition
Installation on raw devices

Use
Raw devices for Oracle databases can improve I/O throughput, but only for databases that are already I/O bound.

Definition
Specifies the OS file name.

Definition

For the offline backup method, leave this field empty. The Software Provisioning Manager automatically performs an instance recovery.

For the online backup method, make sure the database is in backup mode. Also copy the backup controlfiles and the Oracle archives to an existing shared directory. You set the database to backup mode as follows::
Windows: saphostctrl –user sapadm <password> -function PrepareDatabaseCopy -dbname <DBSID> -dbtype ora -dbconfdir <shared_directory> -copymethod Online -timeout -1
UNIX: saphostctrl -function PrepareDatabaseCopy -dbname <DBSID> -dbtype ora -dbconfdir <shared_directory> -copymethod Online -timeout -1

Dependencies
In an LVM scenario the preparation is already done.

Example
Windows: saphostctrl –user sapadm <password> -function PrepareDatabaseCopy -dbname C11 -dbtype ora -dbconfdir c:\temp -copymethod Online -timeout -1 UNIX: saphostctrl -function PrepareDatabaseCopy -dbname C11 -dbtype ora -dbconfdir /tmp -copymethod Online -timeout -1

Use
Select this checkbox to change the path of the target Oracle Home. We only recommended changing the source ID to the target ID

Example
Source Oracle Home: c:\oracle\C11\11203
Target Oracle Home: c:\oracle\D11\11203

Use
Enter the required disk space.

Definition
Displays the required disk space

Definition
Specify CONTROLFILE REUSE to reuse existing control files identified by the initialization parameter CONTROL_FILES, thus ignoring and overwriting any information they currently contain.

Definition
Specify REUSE to allow Oracle to reuse an existing redo log file.

Definition
The path to the specified sapdata directories

Example
Windows: <Drive>:\oracle\<DBSID>\sapdata1
Unix: /oracle/<DBSID>/sapdata1

Use
Specify the drive for the database files.

Use
Specify the drive for your sapdata directories.

Definition
Location where the directories saptrace, sapbackup, and sapreorg are installed.

Example
If you install with database system ID (DBSID) C11, the default value for SAPDATA_HOME is /oracle/C11.

Use
Enter the SAPDATA key for an additional directory in which you want the datafiles to be created.

Dependencies
The sapdata name must match the pattern SAPDATA<#>.

Example
SAPDATA5, SAPDATA6,...

Use
Specify the sapdata size.

Definition
Specifies the drive for the Oracle files, such as saptrace, sapreorg, sapbackup, saparch.

Definition
Specifies the segment space management parameter (possible values: manual / auto).

Use
Select one of the Storage-Based System Copy Recovery Methods.

Definition
Display a table where you can modify the table split parameters tablename, splitcount, columnname.

Use
Mark this checkbox if you want Software Provisioning Manager to stop to show the installed OPS$User from Source System.

Use
Enter the name of the SAP system administrator of the SAP system.
The naming convention for this operating system user is <sapsid>adm, where <sapsid> is the SAP system ID of the SAP system.
For an MCOD connect enter the already available sidadm user.

Example
x11adm , if the SAP System ID is X11.

Definition
Specifies the parameter size of the segment.

Definition
Specifies the size of the redo log files in MB.

Use
Specify whether you want to continue with the installation or interrupt it.

Dependencies
If you have installed the Oracle server software as described in the installation documentation, including the required Oracle patches, continue with the installation now.

Definition
Available space.

Use
Mark this checkbox if you want Software Provisioning Manager to stop after the step createDB has completed so that you can apply Oracle database patches.

Use
Select Standard System Copy or Homogeneous System Copy.

Definition
Specifies the operating system file name of this tablespace.

Definition
Specifies the name of the tablespace.

Definition
Specifies the tablespace status (possible values: online / offline).

Definition
Specifies the tablespace type (possible values: temporary / permanent).

Definition
Specifies the parameter in kilobytes (K), megabytes (M), or gigabytes (G)

Definition
Choose whether you want the system to update the Oracle statistics automatically or whether you want to skip this step and create the Oracle statistics manually with the options below.

area.name: agent
area.item:
Definition
Common location used by all the controllers that are installed on different machines for outputting files.

Use
Pre-populated with a default value appropriate to operating system of installation; you can choose to modify this value.

Definition
Name of the server where your database resides; verify by pinging with name you plan to enter

Definition
For MaxDB, this is the database instance name.

For MS SQLServer, this is the database name.

For Oracle, this is the database instance ID (in earlier Oracle versions) or service_name (in later Oracle versions).

Dependencies
If an Oracle database is going to be accessed remotely, then a tnsnames.ora entry would be required to connect to the database. Usually, the tnsnames.ora entry would just be the database instance ID suffixed with the domain name. See 6.3 Sample tnsnames.ora Entry in the Installation Guide for a sample.

Definition
Relates to the schema (user) password specified in the database installation associated with the Database User.

Definition
Port on which the database listens.

Use
Can be blank if you use the default port.

Dependencies
Required if you have a named instance in a MS SQL Server database.

Example
instance_name

Definition
Database type previously installed

Use
Select database server type.

Definition
Relates to the schema (user) specified in the database installation.

Dependencies
Verify that this user can connect to database using database-specific tools.

Definition
Name of server where SAP RFC Gateway resides

Dependencies
RFC Gateway must have been installed and configured previously.

Definition
Name of service created during installation of the RFC Gateway; this is not case sensitive.

Dependencies
RFC Gateway must have been installed and configured previously.

Example
SAPgw01

Definition
Location to which DF files will be copied.

Use
Pre-populated with a default value appropriate to the operating system for the installation; you can choose to modify this value.

Dependencies
Ensure that you do not overwrite a valid installation with the new entry.

Use
This dictates how many Controller instances will run. Recommended number is twice the number of processors.

Example
If you install the Controller on a server that has 4 processors, you can enter 8 in this field.

Definition
Name created during installation of ODBC driver(s).

Example
See 6.4 Sample .odbc.ini File in the Installation Guide.

area.name: maxdb
area.item:
Definition
Specifies whether or not to overwrite an existing schema of the same name.

Use
  • No - Default; the install will abort if any database objects that it is creating already exist. Select this setting if this is the first time through a new installation.
  • Yes - Will drop existing schema and all existing data will be lost. You should use this only if the previous install failed and you are recovering from that installation.

Definition
Database administrator’s user name

Definition
Database administrator’s password

Definition
Database ID (name)

Definition
Pre-populated with the name of the server on which you are running the installation; you can change this to meet implementation needs, if required.

Definition
Schema name; must be entered in all caps. This new schema will be created at install time.

Example
MY_DF_DATA

Definition
Schema password; must be entered in all caps.

Example
PASS

area.name: mss
area.item:
Definition
Specifies whether or not to overwrite an existing database of the same name.

Use
  • No - Default; the install will abort if any database objects that it is creating already exist. Select this setting if this is the first time through a new installation.
  • Yes - Will drop existing database and all existing data will be lost. You should use this only if the previous install failed and you are recovering from that installation.

Definition
Physical location for database files.

Use
Browse to select the appropriate data directory, unless installing remotely.

Definition
Name of the host, unless you are using a named instance.

Example
For a named instance, enter: host\instance_name

Definition
Host of the SQL instanance on wich the application database should be installed.

Use
Pre-populated with the name of the server on which you are running the installation; you can change this to meet implementation needs, if required. For a default instance you can enter just the host name.

Dependencies
For a named instance use <host machine>\<sql instance name>

Example
localhost\SQLExpress

Definition
Administrator’s password

Definition
Name of SQL login to be created

Definition
Login password

Definition
Initial size of database installation.

Use
Choose the database size:
  • Large - Default; create database with 5 GB memory plus 2 GB log.
  • Small - create database with 500 MB memory plus 50 MB log.

Definition
Administrator’s user name

area.name: ora
area.item:
Definition
Specifies whether or not to overwrite an existing schema of the same name.

Use
  • No - Default; the install will abort if any database objects that it is creating already exist. Select this setting if this is the first time through a new installation.
  • Yes - Will drop existing schema and all existing data will be lost. You should use this only if the previous install failed and you are recovering from that installation.

Definition
Physical location for database files.

Use
Browse to select the appropriate data path on the database server where data files should be created.

Definition
Existing Oracle Database SID in which schema will be created

Definition
Administrator’s user name

Definition
Administrator’s password

Definition
Schema name to create

Definition
Schema password

Definition
Initial size of database installation.

Use
Choose the database size:
  • Large - Default; create database with 5 GB memory plus 500 MB for temporary tablespace.
  • Small - create database with 500 MB memory plus 50 MB for temporary tablespace.

area.name: osdbmigration
area.item:
Definition
SAP kernel archives (*.SAR files) downloaded from https://launchpad.support.sap.com/#/softwarecenter

Use
The manifest files of the downloaded archives (*.SAR files) are evaluated to check whether certain parameters match the values of the source dual-stack system - for example, the keyname parameter - or the values for the target operating system and database type you entered.

Use
Specify whether you want to install the split-off target AS Java system on an operating system or database type different from the source dual-stack system. Otherwise, the kernel from the dual-stack system is archived and used to install the target AS Java system on the same operating system and database type as the source dual-stack system.

Definition
Database type for the split-off target AS Java system

Use
Select the target database type if you want to migrate the target AS Java system to a database type or operating system different from that of the source dual-stack system.

Example
Target database type: SAP HANA

Definition
Operating system for the split-off target AS Java system

Use
Select the target operating system if you want to migrate the target AS Java system to an operating system different from that of the source dual-stack system.

Example
Target operating system: NTAMD64 for Windows 64bit on AMD.

area.name: ERS
area.item:
Definition
The host name for the ERS instance

Use
You can enter either a virtual host name or the physical host name of the ASCS instance. For a high-availability (HA) setup we highly recommend that you do not use the same host name as the ASCS instance.

Definition
The host name for the ERS instance

Use
You can enter either a virtual host name or the physical host name of the SCS instance. For a high-availability (HA) setup we highly recommend that you do not use the same host name as the SCS instance.

Use
Install an ERS instance for this ASCS instance

Definition
An ERS instance replicates the lock table of the Standalone Enqueue Server in the ASCS instance. If the Standalone Enqueue Server fails and restarts, the ERS instance can restore the lock table.

Use
Select this checkbox if you want to install an ERS instance for the ASCS instance on the same physical host as the ASCS instance. You can assign either the physical host name of the ASCS instance or a virtual host name in the Host Name for the ASCS Instance field that opens after you have selected this checkbox.

Definition
An ERS instance replicates the lock table of the Standalone Enqueue Server in the ASCS instance. If the Standalone Enqueue Server fails and restarts, the ERS instance can restore the lock table from the Standalone Enqueue Server.

Use
Select this checkbox if you want to install an ERS instance for the ASCS instance on the same physical host as the ASCS instance. You can assign either the physical host name of the ASCS instance or a virtual host name in the Host Name for the ASCS Instance field that opens after you have selected this checkbox.

area.name: ESH
area.item:
Definition
Host name used for this instance.

Use
If you plan to use virtual hosts, change the default physical host name to the desired virtual host name.

Use
Enter the host name of your license server.

Use
Enter the port of the license server.

Use
If you want to use a license server, select this checkbox.

area.name: gerrit
area.item:
Definition
The HTTPS port for the Gerrit instance

Use
The default port number is 29419.

Dependencies
Make sure this port is not used by other processes.

Definition
Alias of a Java JKS or a PKCS#12 keystore containing the SSL certificate of the server and its private key for HTTPS communication

Use
For more information see HTTPS Server Setup in the Installation Parameters section of the Gerrit installation guide at: https://support.sap.com/sltoolset -> System Provisioning.

Definition
Location of a Java JKS or a PKCS#12 keystore containing the SSL certificate of the server and its private key for HTTPS communication

Use
For more information see HTTPS Server Setup in the Installation Parameters section of the Gerrit installation guide at: https://support.sap.com/sltoolset -> System Provisioning.

Definition
Password of a Java JKS or a PKCS#12 keystore containing the SSL certificate of the server and its private key for HTTPS communication

Use
For more information see HTTPS Server Setup in the Installation Parameters section of the Gerrit installation guide at: https://support.sap.com/sltoolset -> System Provisioning.

Definition
The path to the Git directory on the Gerrit server

Use
The default path is: /usr/sap/SAPSID/GT<Instance Number>/gerrit/git

Definition
The user and password required to access the SMTP server

Definition
The port number of the SMTP server

Definition
The host name of the SMTP Server

Use
Gerrit can send email notifications to users for new and updated changes if an SMTP server is specified. Furthermore, the SMTP server is used to validate email addresses registered by users.

Definition
The user and password required to access the SMTP server

Definition
The SSH port for the Gerrit instance

Use
The default port number is 29418.

Dependencies
Make sure that this port is not used by other processes.

Definition
The host name of the XS Advanced (XSA) runtime where the cloud controller is running.

Definition
The default organization of the XS Advanced (XSA) runtime with the space SAP.

Definition
The password of the administrator user to access the XS Advanced (XSA) runtime.

Definition
The port number of the cloud controller of the XS Advanced (XSA) runtime. You can determine the port with the command xs version.

Definition
The administrator user and password for accessing the XS Advanced (XSA) runtime.

Use
This user must have permissions to administrate the space SAP in your default organization.

area.name: dialog
area.item: Available Options

area.name: idm
area.item:
Definition
The SAP Identity Management administrator

Use
This user has permission to change all the information in SAP Identity Management, and to perform the procedures required for creating jobs and groups, as well as maintaining these.

The role assigned to this user has permission to log in to the REST server for the SAP Identity Management Developer Studio. For security reasons it is recommended that no users have access to this role.

Definition
The owner of the database

Use
This user has the permission to modify the table structure of the database. The purpose of this user is to delegate database administration tasks without having to distribute the password of the SYSTEM user.

Definition
The role assigned to this user provides the permission to log in to the user interface of SAP Identity Management.

Definition
The role assigned to this user is used by the runtime engine and has permission to read and write identity data.

Definition
The role assignded to this user has permission to view jobs and groups in SAP Identity Management, but it does not permit changing any information, except scheduling information.

Definition
This user has permission to add and remove users in the SAP Identity Management Developer Studio, to create the identity store, create packages, modify the identity store schema, and manage access rights for packages.

Use
To log on to SAP Identity Management Developer Studio, the developer administrator needs to be added to the User Management Engine (UME) and to have UME action idm_authenticated_studio assigned through a UME role.

Definition
The name of the user account that is the owner of the database software on file system level

Example
Oracle Database - oracle user
For IBM Db2 – db2inst1 user
For SAP ASE - sybase user

area.name: internal
deployment
area.item:
Definition
Controls the behavior of the deploy controller when deployment errors occur.

Use
Choosing Stop at first error causes the deploy controller to stop when the first deployment error occurs. This is the default and preferred behavior.
Choosing to Skip dependent components and continue causes the deploy controller to skip components that cannot be deployed and continue with the deployment of all components that do not depend on failed ones.

Definition
Forces the Software Provisioning Manager to ignore deployment errors.

Use
We do not recommend that you select this option since the system might be inconsistent after a partial passed deployment.

Definition
Choose the highest internal production layer that you need on your SAP system.

Use
Select the highest layer that you want to install. All layers starting from CORE and up to the selected layer will be deployed on the SAP system.

Dependencies
Only available for internal use

Definition
Specifies the life cycle deployment strategy for applications

Use
Choose one of the following options to adjust the behavior of the deploy controller:
  • Sequential - the deploy controller delivers a component to the containers sequentially and then starts it.
  • Bulk - the deploy controller first delivers the components to the containers. After all the components have been delivered, they are started in the same order in which they are delivered.
  • Disable - the deploy controller delivers the components to the containers without starting the components

Definition
Specifies whether each layer is deployed separately or all layers in a single run.

Use
If selected, each layer is deployed in a separate deployment run. Otherwise all deployment layers are deployed in a single run.

Dependencies
Only available for internal use

Definition
Specifies whether a filter will be applied to the instance to stop all applications.

Use
If selected, a runtime filter to stop all applications is applied after the instance creation. This filter can be removed later using configtool.

Dependencies
Only available for internal use.

Definition
Specifies how the offline phase is performed

Use
Choose one of the following options to adjust the behavior of the deploy controller:
  • Normal - If components are admitted for offline deployment, the Java EE engine is stopped and offline deployment is performed. If components are admitted for online deployment, the Java EE engine is started and online deployment is performed.Offline and online deployment of components work alternately. This is the default behavior.
  • Safety - Components are deployed the same way as using normal option, but the Java EE engine is started and restarted in safety mode. Bear in mind that the Java EE engine is restarted even if there are only online components.

area.name: zeroAdmin
area.item:
Definition
Specifies a custom template to be used.

Use
Choose this option if you need to specify a template that is different from the defined set of templates.

Dependencies
Only available for internal use.

Definition
Specifies the location of custom SDA (Software Deployment Archive) that you want to use as a Zero Administration Template to be deployed on the system.

Use
Choose an SDA file containing the Zero Administration template that you want to use for this system.

Dependencies
Only available for internal use.

Definition
Choose a Zero Administration template for the instance.

Use
Select the template according to your needs. The template affects the instance runtime by setting parameters that map to a specific usage of the system.

Dependencies
Only available for internal use

Definition
Specifies the tool that will be used for initial delivery of Java EE core components.

Use
Choose one of the following :
  • From Scratch deployment of software components - deploys the core components for the system directly to the database from the Software Component Archives (SCAs)
  • Database image load - deploys the core components for the system directly into the database from the precreated Jload database image

Dependencies
Only available for internal use.

Definition
The table contains the archive files with tests that are executed after successful installation.

Use
Proceed as follows to add a file:
1. Choose Add to insert a new line.
2. Enter the path to the archive file, or choose Browse to search for the file.

To remove a test file, select the file and choose Remove.

area.name: LAMA
area.item:
Definition
Comma-separated list of technical identifiers for an archive that is to be considered for checking in addition to predefined archives, according to the Options used by SAP Landscape Management available in the product.catalog file.

Use
This field can be either empty or filled with one or more additional archives from the package definition of the selected product-id.

Dependencies
The archives must be defined in the packages.xml. Otherwise Software Provisioning Manager (SWPM) will stop with an error. It is expected that SAP Landscape Management (LaMa) fills this parameter field automatically with correct values while SWPM is running in unattended mode.

Example
SAPJVM8,IGSHELPER

Definition
Comma-separated list of technical identifiers for a package that is to be considered in addition to predefined packages, according to the Options used by SAP Landscape Management available in the product.catalog file.

Use
This field can be either empty or filled with one or more additional packages (DATA_UNIT on DVD) from the package definition of the selected product-id.

Dependencies
The packages must be defined in the packages.xml. Otherwise Software Provisioning Manager (SWPM) will stop with an error. It is expected that SAP Landscape Management (LaMa) fills this parameter field automatically with correct values while SWPM is running in unattended mode.

Example
BACKUP,PVD

Definition
Technical identifier for the provisioning option in the Welcome screen (product.catalog) to be checked with SAP Landscape Management (LaMa) Repository Check.

Use
Use one value from the drop down list.

Dependencies
You can only choose IDs that are available in this Software Provisioning Manager run.

Example
NW_DI:NW753.HDB.PD

area.name: MDM
area.item:
Definition (Prototype text: M. Breiter)
The directory where MDM is installed (in case of Uninstall) or where MDM has to be installed.

Per default MDM components are installed in a specific directory (e.g. for Windows: C:\program files\SAP MDM 5.5)

Exception:
For MDM server it makes sense to specialize different directories for different runtime data like
- Accelerator data
- Archive data
- Log files
- Report files (repository dependend log files)

Use
Define the standard installation directory where the selected MDM components will be installed


Example
For Windows installation the directory C:\program files\SAP MDM 5.5 is proposed as default

Definition (Prototype text: M. Breiter)
Specify the purpose of current installation activity:
  • Installation
    Install complete or selected MDM components
  • UnInstallation
    Uninstall complete or selected MD components
  • Patch/Hotfix Installation
    Install Patch on top of the existing MDM installation
Use
Select the install/uninstall activity for this step

Definition (Prototype text: M. Breiter)
We offer different options for the MDM components to be installed. With this parameter you select between the installation of

  • MDM client components
    On a client system it does not make sense to install the different MDM server components.
    Using this option only MDM client components like
    - MDM Data Manager
    - MDM Import Manager or
    - MDM Publisher
    are available

  • MDM server components
    On a central host of your MDM landscape it makes sense to install the MDM server components like
    - MDM server or
    - MDM import server
    Usign this option you are able to select MDM server components for installation

  • User defined selection of MDM components
    In some cases it also makes sense to install Server and Client components on the same host - e.g. for test purpose.
    Using this option you will be provided the complete list of available components - depending on the scenario selected in the MDm scenario option.

Use
Depending on the value of this field the list of available MDM components is restricted or not.

Dependencies
This field is directly dependent from the Scenario Selection field. Both fields togehter are defining the list of avaialable MDM components for installation.

Example
If you have selected Client components you will not be able to install MDM server.

Definition (Prototype text: M. Breiter)
Decide in detail what are the MDM components to be installed.
In the second column you see the type of the component (client or server component)

Use
Use the flag on first column to switch on/off the installation of a component

Dependencies
The content of this table is directly dependent on the definition of the Scenario (Consolidation vs. RPCM) and the Installation Type (Client versus Server components)

Definition (Prototype text: M. Breiter)
The Scenario Selection restricts the available components for the installation. Available values are:
  • Consolidation
    MDM supports the consolidation of master data from different source system in one MDM repository, e.g.consolidating material master data from SAP R/3 MM and product data from a SAP CRM system.

  • RPCM (Rich Product Content Management)
    Main purpose of the RPCM scenario is to provide a central catalogue for product data with main functionalities Publishing (Print and Web publishing) and/or Product Retrieval.
    With the RPCM scenario also the MDM Publisher and the DTP specific Plug-Ins are available

  • All
    All available MDM components are offered for installation

Use
Select one of the available scenarios.

Dependencies
Dependend on your selection the list of components available for installation is distinguished. This parameter is also dependend on the install option you have selected (client or server components).

Example
If you select RPCM you will be able to install the MDM Publisher executable.

area.name: mscs
area.item:
Use
Select the SAP cluster group to be configured to run on this additional cluster node.

Definition
SAP instance type to cluster

Use
You can cluster the following instance types with Microsoft Failover Cluster:
  • SCS instance - based only on AS Java
    Only the Java SCS instance is clustered.

  • ASCS instance - based only on AS ABAP
    Only the ABAP ASCS instance is clustered.

  • ASCS and SCS instance - based on AS ABAP and AS Java
    Both the ABAP ASCS and Java SCS instances are clustered.
    They belong to the same SAP system.
    The ASCS and SCS instance files are located on the same shared disk.
    They are part of the same SAP cluster group and use the same virtual host name.

Use
You have to specify the location of the executable file linkd.exe.
This executable is part of the Microsoft Windows Server 2003 Server Resource Kit, which you can download as follows:
  1. Go to http://www.microsoft.com.
  2. Search for Microsoft Windows Server 2003 Resource Kit Tool.

Use
You have selected to remove the SAP cluster group.
Select an existing cluster group to which the shared disk of the SAP cluster group has to be moved.

Definition
Supports multiple SAP systems in one Microsoft Failover Cluster

Use
This clusters an additional SAP system in the same Microsoft Failover Cluster.
You must have already prepared your system for this option as described in the installation guide.

Use
Choose whether you want to remove the SAP cluster group.

Dependencies
If you select to remove the SAP cluster group, you also have to select an existing cluster group to which the shared disk of this SAP cluster group has to be moved.

Use
Choose whether you want to remove the SAP cluster group.

Dependencies
If you select to remove the SAP cluster group, you also have to select an existing cluster group to which the shared disk of this SAP cluster group has to be moved.

Use
Select the local drive for the local instances to be installed.

Example
This is the drive where the ASCS instance (FSC only), ERS instance, SAP Host Agent, application servers, and Diagnostics Agent are installed.

Use
Select the shared drive for the clustered SAP instances to be installed.

Example
This is the drive where the ASCS instance is installed.

Use
If you choose to use DHCP (Windows Server 2008 only), the virtual IP addresses are configured automatically as DHCP-based IP addresses. The DHCP-based IP addresses are only supported when all Failover Cluster nodes are located in the same subnet.

Use
Decide if you want to use an existing SAP cluster group.
If so, select it.

Definition
The cluster nodes must be connected by a private and public network.
The public network enables communication from the cluster nodes to other resources in the local area network (LAN).

Use
Choose the public network for the clustered SAP instances.

Definition
Virtual host name (Network Name) of the 'SAP <SID> ' cluster group

Use
The virtual host name is used by the SCS or ASCS instance.
All application servers use this virtual name to connect to the SCS or ASCS instance.
The virtual host name is also a GLOBALHOSTNAME, as the global files are located on the same disk.

Dependencies

Windows Server 2003:
You have to reserve a virtual host name (network name) and its IP address on a DNS Server. Make sure that the IP address of SAP virtual instance host matches the network subnet mask.

Windows Server 2008:
  • If you choose not to use DHCP, you have to reserve a virtual host name (network name) and its IP address on a DNS Server.
    Make sure that the IP address of the SAP virtual instance host matches the network subnet mask.

  • If you choose to use DHCP, the virtual IP addresses are configured automatically as DHCP-based IP addresses.
    The DHCP-based IP addresses are currently only supported when all MSFC nodes are located in the same subnet.
