area.name: prerequisite_checker
area.item:
Use
If you have downloaded an XML file that contains the data for the prerequisite checks from SAP Service Marketplace, select this file. Otherwise accept the default.

Use
Select this checkbox, if you want to check specific prerequisites for this Software Provisioning Manager option.
Also select this checkbox, if you plan to run this Software Provisioning Manager option on this machine.

Definition
You can check prerequisites for the Software Provisioning Manager option to be executed.

Use
Enter the database name.

Definition
The role this database plays for the Software Provisioning Manager option whose prerequisites you are about to check.

Use
Select the type of the database that is to be used for this Software Provisioning Manager option.

Use
Enter the version of the database server software.
The first characters must be one or more digits describing the version.

Example
If your database version is V8.1, enter 8.1.

Use
Enter the Java home directory that you plan to use for the system to be installed. This directory is the home directory of your Java Runtime Environment (JRE) or Java Development Kit (JDK) installation. It must have a subdirectory bin containing the java executable.

Use
Enter the name of the JDBC driver.

Example
oracle.jdbc.OracleDriver

Use
Select the JDBC driver that you want to use for the connect.

Use
Enter the database JDBC URL.

Use
Enter the database user password.

Use
For more information, see the installation guides at https://support.sap.com/sloolset -> System Provisioning .
For more information, see the installation guides at https://support.sap.com/sloolset -> System Provisioning .

Use
Select the Secure Store key file that you want to use for the connect.

Use
If required, enter the Secure Store key phrase.

Use
Select the Secure Store properties file that you want to use for the connect.

Definition
For the prerequisite checks for this Software Provisioning Manager option, information about your SAP system is required.

Use
Select this checkbox if you do not have any connect information.

Definition
The role this system plays for the installation option.

Use
Select this checkbox if the Software Provisioning Manager option is part of a Unicode system.

Use
Enter the name of the database user that you want to use for the connect.

area.name: nw07
liveCycle
area.item:
Description

You perform this step on a Domain Controller (DC) with domain administrator's rights.
The domain administrator must be a member of the schema Admins group and have the rights to access the registry on a DC that has the role of a schema master.

Extends the schema for the SAP data types, creates a root container for the storage of SAP-specific information, and creates accounts that allow directory access.

Description

If required, you can add an application server instances to an already installed SAP system.

Application Server Instance
Application server instances are SAP instances that include:

  • Dispatcher
  • IGS
  • CCMS agents
  • Java server processes - with software units based on AS Java
  • Gateway and certain ABAP work processes (dialog, batch, spool, or update) - with software units based on AS ABAP

Description

You perform this option if you want to enable the LDAP connection to you SAP system.
You must have extended the LDAP schema for the SAP data types before.
You start the service on an application server host with access to SAP system profiles.

Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP)
An LDAP directory service is suited to integrating external systems and SAP systems into a heterogeneous system landscape.

Description

Before performing this step, make sure that you have identified the required scenario as described in the Master Guide.
This step is already included in the SAP Systems installation.

Enables software units in addition to AS Java on your SAP system.

Software Units

Software units can be run together with others in one system or each software unit can run separately on different systems. Software units are realized by installing (and configuring) a collection of software components.
The units Application Server ABAP (AS ABAP) and Application Server Java (AS Java) are also used as a foundation for other units.

Description

This is only needed if you want to use global accounts which are configured on a separate host.

Creates all operating system accounts for your SAP system or standalone engine.

Description

Checks your installation host for compliance with most of the prerequisites defined in the installation guide.
This check is also integrated in the SAP NetWeaver 7.1 installation tasks.

Description

If you remove a SAP system which is distributed on several hosts (distributed system), you uninstall in the following order:

  • All Additional Application Servers Instances besides the first one - formerly kwown as dialog instances,
  • The Database Instance - database software might to be removed manually, depending on the type of the database),
  • The primary Application Server Instance - formerly known as central instance,
  • All Central Service Instances respectively the Global Host Preparation

Uninstalls a SAP system, a single SAP system instance, or a standalone engine / optional standalone unit.

Description

This option is only for uninstalling a MaxDB database instance. If you want to delete a distributed system, you have to run Software Provisioning Manager to delete the required instances locally on each of the hosts belonging to the SAP system in the following sequence:

  • All Application Server Instances beside of the primary one - known as dialog instances
  • Database Instance
  • Primary Application Server Instance - known as central instance
  • Central Service Instance

Removes MaxDB database instances of a Content Server and / or Cache Server installation.

area.name: sapSystems
abap
area.item:
Description

Mandatory step in installing SAP system distributed on several hosts, where the software units are based on AS ABAP.

Installs a database instance.

Database Instance

The SAP system with software units based on AS ABAP uses its own database schema in the database.

Description

First step in installing a SAP system with software units based on AS ABAP distributed on several hosts (distributed system).

Prepares this host as SAP global host for your SAP system by:

  • Preparing the file system
  • Creating the profile
  • Installing the executable

Description

Last step in installing a SAP system with software units based on AS ABAP distributed on several hosts (distributed system).
You must have finished the Database Instance installation.

Installs the primary application server instance.

Application Server Instance

The application server instance is the core component of an SAP system. It usually provides all SAP system utilities. At least one application server instance must exist in each SAP system.

You can find the installation option for additional application server instances below Additional Software Life-Cycle Tasks

area.name: abapJava
area.item:
Description

Second step in installing an SAP system with software units based on AS ABAP and AS Java distributed on several hosts (distributed system).
You must have finished the Central Services Instance (SCS) installation.

Installs a database instance.

Database Instance

The SAP system software units AS ABAP and AS Java use their own database schema in the same database.

Description

Last step in installing an SAP system with software units based on AS ABAP and AS Java distributed on several hosts (distributed system).
Installs the primary application server instance and enables additional software units based on AS ABAP and AS Java if required.
You must have finished the Database Instance installation.
This step is not repeatable.

Application Server Instance
The application server instance is the core component of an SAP system. It usually provides all SAP system utilities.

You can find the installation option for additional application server instances below Additional Software Life-Cycle Tasks.

Description

First step in installing a SAP system with software units based on AS ABAP and AS Java distributed on several hosts.

Installs a central services instance (SCS) and prepares this host as SAP global host.

Central Services Instance

The central services instance is the main point of communication and synchronization for the application server instances and consists of the message service and the enqueue service.

area.name: java
area.item:
Description

Second step in installing a SAP system with software units based on AS Java distributed on several hosts (distributed system).
You must have finished the Central Services Instance (SCS) installation.

Installs a database instance.

Database Instance

The SAP system with software units based on AS Java uses its own database schema in the database.

Description

Last step in installing a SAP system with software units based on AS Java distributed on several hosts (distributed system).
You must have finished the Database Instance installation.
This step is not repeatable.

Installs the primary application server instance and enables additional software units based on AS Java if required.

Application Server Instance

The application server is the core component of an SAP system. It usually provides all SAP system utilities. At least one application server instance must exist in each SAP system.

You can find the installation option for additional application server instances below Additional Software Life-Cycle Tasks

Description

First step in installing a SAP system with software units based on AS Java distributed on several hosts.

Installs a central services instance (SCS) and prepares this host as SAP global host.

Central Services Instance

The central services instance is the main point of communication and synchronization for the application server instances and consists of the message service and the enqueue service.

area.name: abap
area.item:
Description

Mandatory step in installing a high-availability SAP system distributed on several hosts.
Make sure that you install the application server instance on a host other than the primary application server instance host. If you install the application server instance on one of the MSFC nodes, make sure that you use a local drive, not a shared drive.

Installs an application server instance.

Application Server Instance
Application server instances are SAP instances that include:

  • Dispatcher
  • IGS
  • CCMS agents
  • Java server processes - with software units based on AS Java
  • Gateway and certain ABAP work processes (dialog, batch, spool, or update) - with software units based on AS ABAP

Description

You must have configured the first MSFC node.

Configures an additional MSFC node to run the SAP cluster group.

Microsoft Failover Cluster (MSFC)

With MSFC you enable critical system components, so-called Single Points of Failure (SPOFs) to be automatically switched from one machine to the other, if hardware or software problems arise on one machine. With the help of this switchover - or failover - the system can continue functioning normally so that unplanned system downtime is avoided.

Description

Mandatory step in installing a SAP system with software units based on AS ABAP distributed on several hosts.
If your database instance is to be installed in the same Microsoft Failover Cluster as the ASCS instance, you must perform this step on the first node of this Microsoft Failover Cluster.
If your database instance is to be installed in a different Microsoft Failover Cluster from the ASCS instance, you perform this step on another Microsoft Failover Cluster.
You must have finished the Central Services Instance for ABAP (ASCS) installation.

Installs a database instance.

Database Instance

The SAP system with software units based on AS Java uses its own database schema in the database.

Description

You must perform this step on all MSFC nodes where the Java central services (SCS) instance or ABAP central services instance (ASCS) is installed and clustered.

Installs an enqueue replication server instance.

Enqueue Replication Server Instance

The enqueue replication server instance contains a replica of the lock table (replication table).

Description

You must have already completed the Central Services Instance installation.

Creates the SAP cluster group on the first Microsoft Failover Cluster (MSFC) node and adds the ASCS instance to the SAP cluster group.

Microsoft Failover Cluster (MSFC)
With MSFC you enable critical system components, so-called Single Points of Failure (SPOFs) to be automatically switched from one machine to the other, if hardware or software problems arise on one machine. With the help of this switchover - or failover - the system can continue functioning normally so that unplanned system downtime is avoided.

Description

Mandatory step in installing a high-availability SAP system distributed on several hosts (distributed system), where the software units are based on AS ABAP.
You must have finished the Database Instance installation.
This step is not repeatable.
If you install the primary application server on one of the MSFC nodes, make sure that you use a local drive, not a shared drive.

Installs the primary application server instance and enables additional software units if required.

Application Server Instance

The application server instance is the core component of an SAP system. It usually provides all SAP system utilities. At least one application server instance must exist in each SAP system.

You can find the installation option for additional application server instances below Additional Software Life-Cycle Tasks

Description

First step in installing a high-availability SAP system distributed on several hosts, where the software units are based on AS ABAP. You must install it on a shared disk.

Installs a central services instance for ABAP (ASCS) and prepares this host as SAP global host.

Central Services Instance for ABAP

The central services instance is the main point of communication and synchronization for the application server instances and consists of the message service and the enqueue service.

area.item:

  • Dispatcher
  • IGS

  • Java server processes - with software units based on AS Java

The central services instance is the main point of communication and synchronization for the application server instances and consists of the message service and the enqueue service.

Description

Mandatory step in installing a SAP system with software units based on AS ABAP and AS Java distributed on several hosts.
If your database instance is to be installed in the same Microsoft Failover Cluster as the SCS and ASCS instance, you must perform this step on the first node of this Microsoft Failover Cluster.
If your database instance is to be installed in a different Microsoft Failover Cluster from the SCS instance, you perform this step on another Microsoft Failover Cluster.
You must have finished the Central Services Instance (ASCS) and Central Services Instance for ABAP (ASCS) installation.

Installs a database instance.

Database Instance

The SAP system with software units based on AS Java uses its own database schema in the database.

Description

Mandatory step in installing a SAP system with software units based on AS ABAP and AS Java distributed on several hosts.
If your database instance is to be installed in the same Microsoft Failover Cluster as the SCS and ASCS instance, you must perform this step on the first node of this Microsoft Failover Cluster.
If your database instance is to be installed in a different Microsoft Failover Cluster from the SCS instance, you perform this step on another Microsoft Failover Cluster.
You must have finished the Central Services Instance (ASCS) and Central Services Instance for ABAP (ASCS) installation.

Installs a database instance.

Database Instance

The SAP system with software units based on AS Java uses its own database schema in the database.

Description

You must perform this step on all MSFC nodes where the Java central services (SCS) instance or ABAP central services instance (ASCS) is installed and clustered.

Installs an enqueue replication server instance.

Enqueue Replication Server Instance

The enqueue replication server instance contains a replica of the lock table (replication table).

Description

You must have already completed the Central Services Instance installation.

Creates the SAP cluster group on the first Microsoft Failover Cluster (MSFC) node and adds the ASCS and SCS instance(s) to the SAP cluster group.

Microsoft Failover Cluster (MSFC)

With MSFC you enable critical system components, so-called Single Points of Failure (SPOFs) to be automatically switched from one machine to the other, if hardware or software problems arise on one machine. With the help of this switchover - or failover - the system can continue functioning normally so that unplanned system downtime is avoided.

Description

You must have finished the Database Instance installation.
This step is not repeatable.
If you install the primary application server instance on one of the MSFC nodes, make sure that you use a local drive, not a shared drive.

Installs the primary application server instance and enables additional software units if required.

Application Server Instance
The application server is the core component of an SAP system. It usually provides all SAP system utilities.

You can find the installation option for additional application server instances below Additional Software Life-Cycle Tasks.

Description

You must install it on the same shared disk as the ASCS instance. You must have already performed the Central Services Instance for ABAP (ASCS) installation.

Installs a central services (SCS) instance.

Central Services Instance

The central services instance is the main point of communication and synchronization for the application server instances and consists of the message service and the enqueue service.

area.item:
Description

Mandatory step in installing a high-availability SAP system distributed on several hosts.
Make sure that you install the application server instance on a host other than the primary application server instance host. If you install the application server instance on one of the MSFC nodes, make sure that you use a local drive, not a shared drive.

Application Server Instance

  • Dispatcher
  • IGS
  • CCMS agents
  • Java server processes - with software units based on AS Java
  • Gateway and certain ABAP work processes (dialog, batch, spool, or update) - with software units based on AS ABAP

You must have finished the Central Services Instance (SCS) installation.

Database Instance

The SAP system with software units based on AS Java uses its own database schema in the database.

Description

Microsoft Failover Cluster (MSFC)

With MSFC you enable critical system components, so-called Single Points of Failure (SPOFs) to be automatically switched from one machine to the other, if hardware or software problems arise on one machine. With the help of this switchover - or failover - the system can continue functioning normally so that unplanned system downtime is avoided.

Description

Mandatory step in installing a high-availability SAP system distributed on several hosts (distributed system), where the software units are based on AS Java.
You must have finished the Database Instance installation.
This step is not repeatable.
If you install the primary application server instance on one of the MSFC nodes, make sure that you use a local drive, not a shared drive.

Installs the primary application server instance and enables additional software units if required.

Application Server Instance

The application server instance is the core component of an SAP system. It usually provides all SAP system utilities.

You can find the installation option for additional application server instances below Additional Software Life-Cycle Tasks.

Description

First step in installing a high-availability SAP system distributed on several hosts, where the software units are based on AS Java.
You must install it on a shared disk.

Installs a central services (SCS) instance and prepares this host as SAP global host.

Central Services Instance

The central services instance is the main point of communication and synchronization for the application server instances and consists of the message service and the enqueue service.

Description

Installs on one host (standard system) a SAP system including software units. At least one of the foundation software units AS ABAP or AS Java is required.

Standard System

The following instances will be installed:

  • Central Services Instance (SCS) - with software units based on AS Java
  • Database Instance
  • Application Server Instance

The central services instance is the main point of communication and synchronization for the application server instances and consists of the message service and the enqueue service.

The SAP system usage types AS ABAP and AS Java use their own database schema in the same database.

The application server instance is the core component of an SAP system and usually provides all SAP system utilities.

Software units can be run together with others in one system or each software unit can run separately on different systems. They are realized by installing (and configuring) a collection of software components.
The units Application Server ABAP (AS ABAP) and Application Server Java (AS Java) are also used as a foundation for other units.

area.name: standalone
area.item:
Description

Installs the Adapter Engine (JEE) with Oracle separately on this host.

A central Adapter Engine is automatically installed with software unit Process Integration (PI/XI)

Description

Installs the Application Sharing Server with Oracle separately on this host.

For productive use, we recommend that you install the server separately on a dedicated host. This reduces networking and SAP JEE demands generated by the server on the portal machine.
In addition to this installation the Application Sharing Server is automatically installed with software unit Enterprise Portal.

Description

Installs Content Server and / or Cache Server together with optional MaxDB database instances.

Description

Installs a standalone gateway on this host.

Standalone Gateway

Each instance of an SAP system has a gateway. The gateway enables communication between work processes and external programs, as well as communication between work processes from different instances or SAP systems. You can also install a standalone gateway instance. With the standalone gateway, you can install the gateway service separately from the SAP system, In this case, the SAP system can access each external gateway under a different RFC connection.

Description
This step installs a liveCache client to you already existing SAP system application server instance. You must perform this step on each application server instance if you want to run at least one SAP application that requires liveCache.
Do not perform this step if you use an application that does not require liveCache.
You do not need to perform this step if you are installing a SCM system with liveCache.

Description

Installs MaxDB database instances for a Content Server and / or Cache Server

Description

Installs the SAP Partner Connectivity Kit with Oracle separately on this host.

Description

First step for TREX system installation with a separated global file system. After this task has finished, you can install a TREX instance using the task TREX Instance.

Installs the TREX global file system on a local host.

Description

A TREX system global file system has to be available as a prerequisite.

Installs an additional TREX instance on the local host or updates a TREX system landscape.

Description

First step in a TREX System installation.

Installs the TREX global file system together with a TREX instance on the local host.

For adding additional TREX instances to a TREX landscape or updating the landscape use the task TREX Instance.

Description

You install the SAP Web Dispatcher for a SAP system when your SAP system is already available.

area.name: source
area.item:
Description

Mandatory step of a system copy.

Export

The following steps will be performed:

  • Creating the export directory structure with label files and source system information (if required)
  • Creating database structure files (*.STR) for ABAP database objects
  • Updating database statistics (depending on the database platform and the selected options)
  • Size calculation for the target database (*.EXT, DBSIZE.XML)
  • Exporting the ABAP and / or Java database content

Description

Optional step for preparing the export of a SAP NetWeaver 2007 system. The export preparations are required, if:

  • you want to build up the target system up to the point where the database load starts, before the export of the source system has finished
  • export and import processes should run in parallel during the system copy process

Export Preparations

The following steps will be performed:

  • Creating the export directory structure with label files and source system information
  • Creating database structure files (*.STR)
  • Updating database statistics (depending on the database platform and the selected dialog option)
  • Size calculation for the target database (*.EXT, DBSIZE.XML)

Description

Optional step for preparing the splitting of tables before starting the export of a SAP NetWeaver 2007 system based on AS ABAP.

If some of the tables to be copied are very large, the downtime can be decreased by splitting the large tables into several smaller packages, which can then be processed in parallel.

Table Splitting Preparations

The following steps will be performed:

  • Creating the export directory DATA.
  • Creating database structure files (*.STR) for the tables to be split.
  • Splitting the generated STR files.
  • Creating where-conditions for the tables to be split.
  • Splitting the generated WHR files.
  • Copying the resulting WHR files to the export directory DATA.

area.name: target
area.item:
Description

Installs a SAP system including software units based on AS ABAP on one host (standard system).

Check your installation guide whether you can run the installation on a different host than the database host.

You can find the installation option for additional application server instances below Additional Software Life-Cycle Tasks.

Standard System

The standard system based on AS ABAP consists of:
  • Database Instance
  • Application Server Instance

The SAP system software unit AS ABAP uses its own database schema in the database.

The application server instance is the core component of an SAP system. It usually provides all SAP system utilities.

Description

Installs a SAP system including software units based on AS ABAP and AS Java on one host (standard system).

Check your installation guide whether you can run the installation on a different host than the database host.

You can find the installation option for additional application server instances below Additional Software Life-Cycle Tasks.

Standard System

The standard system based on AS Java consists of:

  • Central Services Instance (SCS)
  • Database Instance
  • Application Server Instance

The central services instance is the main point of communication and synchronization for the application server instances and consists of the message service and the enqueue service.

The SAP system software units AS ABAP and AS Java use their own database schemas in the same database.

The application server instance is the core component of an SAP system and usually provides all SAP system utilities.

Description

Installs a SAP system including software units based on AS Java on one host (standard system).

Check your installation guide whether you can run the installation on a different host than the database host.

You can find the installation option for additional application server instances below Additional Software Life-Cycle Tasks.

Standard System

The standard system based on AS Java consists of:

  • Central Services Instance (SCS)
  • Database Instance
  • Application Server Instance

The central services instance is the main point of communication and synchronization for the application server instances and consists of the message service and the enqueue service.

The SAP system with software units based on AS Java uses its own database schema in the database.

The application server instance is the core component of an SAP system and usually provides all SAP system utilities.

Description

Installations for SAP NetWeaver Adapter Engine.

SAP NetWeaver Adapter Engine

You use the Adapter Engine to connect to SAP systems (RFC adapter) and external systems. You use the various adapters in the Adapter Engine to convert XML- and HTTP-based messages to the specific protocol and format required by these systems, and the other way around.

Description

Installation for an additional application server instance. This option is repeatable and requires that you have installed a primary application server instance before (not repeatable).

Description

Enables software units or optional NetWeaver standalone units in addition to AS Java on your SAP system.
Before performing this step, make sure that you have identified the required scenario as described in the Master Guide.

Software Units

Software units can be run together with others in one system or each software unit can run separately on different systems. Software units are realized by installing (and configuring) a collection of software components.
The units Application Server ABAP (AS ABAP) and Application Server Java (AS Java) are also used as a foundation for other units.

Description

Tasks for preparing the installation hosts.

Description

For already installed or upgrades systems and for standalone engines / optional standalone units additional lifecycle management tasks are provided:

  • Additional Preparation Tasks: Prepare the installation hosts.
  • Additional Application Server Instances: Add more application server instances to an installed SAP system.
  • Additional Java Components: Add software units or optional standalone units to an existing system based on AS Java.
  • Database Tools: Add database partitions (only for IBM Db2 for Linux, UNIX, and Windows).
  • Java Add-In for ABAP: Add software units based on AS Java to an system based on AS ABAP only.
  • System Copy: Export tasks to perform on the source system that has to be copied and installations for installing the target system.
  • Uninstall: Remove an SAP system or an SAP system instance.

Description

Installations for SAP NetWeaver Application Sharing Server (RTC).

SAP NetWeaver Application Sharing Server

SAP Application Sharing Server provides data streaming services that enable application sharing capabilities provided by SAP NetWeaver Collaboration. The server handles the flow of data between portal users collaborating through the RTC-based application sharing feature. RTC application sharing allows users to share their Windows desktop or individual applications with other portal users in real time. Remote users can interact directly with the shared desktop or application as if they were sitting at the host's machine.

Description

Installation of an ABAP system on SAP HANA.

Based on AS ABAP

This system variant was formerly known as ABAP system or ABAP standalone.

Description

Installation of an SAP NetWeaver 7.1 system with software units based on AS ABAP and AS Java.

Based on AS ABAP and AS Java

This system variant was formerly known as ABAP+Java system or double stack system. It consists of ABAP and the Java engine and auxiliary services.

Description

Installation of an SAP NetWeaver 7.1 system with software units based on AS Java.

Based on AS Java

This system variant was formerly known as Java system or Java standalone. There is no ABAP application server.

Description

Installations for SAP Content Server.

SAP Content Server

The SAP Content Server is based on the database system MaxDB. Therefore, besides the MaxDB, an independent content server is always available in every SAP system installation. Thus, the SAP system provides the necessary technical infrastructure for all document-centric applications and business scenarios that do not require a long-term archiving solution. Since the SAP Content Server is also integrated via the HTTP interface the actual storage medium used remains completely transparent to SAP applications. Applications that use the technical infrastructure of the SAP Content Server include the SAP Business Workplace, SAP ArchiveLink, the Document Management System (DMS), and the Knowledge Warehouse.
The SAP Content Server is not intended to replace optical storage systems and other storage media for long-term document archiving.

SAP Cache Server

The purpose of the Cache Server is to provide the following benefits:

  • Seamless, transparent integration into existing content server landscapes
  • Significant reduction in client response times
  • As little administration work as possible

Cache servers are used to speed up access to document content. This is particularly useful if the content is required for display in a Web browser, for example. Cache servers can also reduce the network load and thereby enhance performance. It is therefore also a task of the cache to provide the client with documents from a physically close location, even if the content server is located on a different continent. Cache servers are similar to content servers, but require less administration with the same level of access protection.

Description

SAP NetWeaver 7.1 system with the instances distributed on separate hosts.

Distribution of SAP System Instances

All mandatory instances are distributed on separate hosts.
Mandatory instances of a SAP system are:

  • Central Services Instance for ABAP (ASCS) - with software units based on AS ABAP
  • Database Instance
  • Application Server Instance

If required, you can have one or more additional application server instances.

Description

Installation for SAP NetWeaver Standalone Gateway.

SAP NetWeaver Standalone Gateway

With the standalone gateway, you can install the gateway service separately from the SAP system. In this case, the SAP system can access each external gateway under a different RFC connection.

Description

SAP NetWeaver 7.1 system for a high-availability scenario. Mandatory instances are distributed on separate hosts.

Distribution of SAP System Instances

Mandatory instances of a SAP system are:

  • Central Services Instance for ABAP (ASCS) - with software units based on AS ABAP
  • Database Instance
  • Primary Application Server Instance
  • Additional Application Server Instance

If required, you can have one or more additional application server instances.

Description

Initial installation options for an SAP system

Description

Installations for SAP liveCache.

SAP liveCache

SAP liveCache is based on MaxDB technology and ensures the highest SAP system performance. liveCache is SAP's state of the art memory based computing technology for real-time, high speed processing of very large data volumes.

Description

Installations for @PRODUCT@.

Choose whether you want to install:

  • SAP Systems with one or more software units,
  • Standalone Engines, or
  • Optional Standalone Units

If you are installing an SAP system, you navigate to your installation by selecting first the desired distribution option (the distribution option defines how you want to distribute the SAP system instances to hosts). After you have started the SAP system installation, you can select the software units that you require for your scenario as listed in the Master Guide - such as Enterprise Portal (EP) or Process Integration (PI).
Additional Software Life-Cycle Management Tasks comprises options that can be performed in addition to installations and upgrades - for example, System Copy, Java Add-In, or Uninstall.

Overview

Note that the figure below illustrates the possible installation options only on a general overview level. For more information, see the Master Guide at https://help.sap.com/ -> <Product> <Version>.

Description

Optional standalone units are additional software units that you install separately. They provide specific (server) functions in combination with one or more SAP systems.

Software Units

Software units can be run together with others in one system or each software unit can run separately on different systems. Software units are realized by installing (and configuring) a collection of software components.
The units Application Server ABAP (AS ABAP) and Application Server Java (AS Java) are also used as a foundation for other units.

Description

Installations for SAP NetWeaver Partner Connectivity Kit (PCK).

SAP NetWeaver Partner Connectivity Kit

SAP Partner Connectivity Kit enables a system of a smaller company or subsidiary that does not run a full blown SAP NetWeaver but Application Server Java (AS Java). It connects to your SAP NetWeaver systems with software units Process Integration (PI/XI). PCK is a Java-based application running on the Java engine that uses the Adapter Framework, which is also the basis for the SAP Adapter Engine.

Description

SAP systems are the main building blocks of a system landscape. They are configured for a certain purpose indicated by one or more software unit. You will be asked for the Software Units you would like to install.

Software Units

Software units can be run together with others in one system or each software unit can run separately on different systems. Software units are realized by installing (and configuring) a collection of software components.
The software units Application Server ABAP (AS ABAP) and Application Server Java (AS Java) are also used as a foundation for other units.

Description

Additional standalone engines for your SAP system. Standalone engines are not part of a specific SAP NetWeaver software units and therefore do not run on Application Server ABAP (AS ABAP) or Application Server Java (AS Java).

Description

SAP NetWeaver 7.1 system with all instances on the same host.

SAP System Instances

Mandatory instances of a SAP system are:

  • Central Services Instance (SCS) - with software units based on AS Java
  • Database Instance
  • Application Server Instance

If required, you can have one or more additional application server instances. You can find the installation options for additional application server instances below Additional Software Life-Cycle Tasks

Export for system copy.

This system variant was formerly known as ABAP system or ABAP standalone.

Description

SAP systems are the main building blocks of a system landscape. They are configured for a certain purpose indicated by one or more software unit. You will be asked for the Software Units you would like to install.

Software Units

Software units can be run together with others in one system or each software unit can run separately on different systems. Software units are realized by installing (and configuring) a collection of software components.
The software units Application Server ABAP (AS ABAP) and Application Server Java (AS Java) are also used as a foundation for other units.

Description

Tasks for system copy:

  • Exporting the source system
  • Building up the target system

Description

Installations for SAP NetWeaver Search and Classification (TREX).

SAP NetWeaver Search and Classification (TREX)

SAP TREX services include search and retrieval in large document collections, text mining, automatic document classification, and search and aggregation over structured data in SAP applications. TREX can handle text from documents in numerous formats, including Microsoft Office and Adobe formats (PDF), and more than 30 languages. TREX search options, such as exact, boolean, fuzzy or linguistic search, and classification options such as query-based or example-based classification, offer great power and flexibility to end users.

Description

Uninstall for systems, instances and standalone engines.

Description

Installation for SAP Web Dispatcher.

SAP Web Dispatcher

The SAP Web Dispatcher lies between the Internet and your SAP system. It is the entry point for HTTP(s) requests into your system, which consists of one or more Web application servers. As a "software web switch", the SAP Web Dispatcher can reject or accept connections. When it accepts a connection, it balances the load to ensure an even distribution across the servers.
It is also beneficial to use the SAP Web Dispatcher, if you do not need security functions (entry point in the DMZ, SSL, URL filtering), but you simply want to balance the load between several SAP Web Application Server instances.

<html> <head>
</head> <body> SAP Business Suite is a suite of business software designed to enable companies to manage the entire value chain across business networks, allowing the company to adapt quickly and remain flexible when faced with changing business conditions. </body> </html>

<html> <head>
</head> <body> SAP Business Suite is a family of adaptive business applications that optimizes your most critical business processes. </body> </html>

<html> <head>
</head> <body> SAP Business Suite applications include SAP ERP, SAP Customer Relationship Management, SAP Product Lifecycle Management, SAP Supply Chain Management, and SAP Supplier Relationship Management. </body> </html>

<html> <head>
</head> <body> SAP Business Suite is designed to reduce the total cost of IT infrastructure ownership (TCO). </body> </html>

<html> <head>
</head> <body> SAP Business Suite can be deployed on a variety of computer hardware types and different operating systems. </body> </html>

<html> <head>
</head> <body> Most SAP Business Suite applications work through complex interaction between components and modules written in Java and ABAP, SAP's language for writing SAP Business Suite applications. </body> </html>

<html> <head>
</head> <body> SAP Business Suite can be tailored to suit the requirements of most industries. Industry applications employ our substantial industry experience acquired over years of providing industry-specific business applications. </body> </html>

<html> <head>
</head> <body> SAP NetWeaver Portal is a flexible, reliable, and secure solution that lets you take advantage of all your information assets. Based on open standards, it integrates any enterprise information source and protects your investment as technologies evolve. </body> </html>

<html> <head>
</head> <body> SAP NetWeaver Portal provides a role-based, secure and Web-based interface to all information, applications and services. To run the portal, you need a standard browser on the desktop; no additional software components are required. </body> </html>

<html> <head>
</head> <body> As part of SAP NetWeaver Portal, the portal infrastructure provides secure access to structured data coming from any kind of business application, such as data warehouses, databases, and SAP or non-SAP applications. </body> </html>

<html> As a key technology of the portal infrastructure, iViews allow access for reading purposes or to carry out an operation, such as submitting a form for supplies. A set of portal services is provided that enables iViews to interact with each other. </html>

<html> Portal roles structure and deliver targeted content to each end user. Thanks to the role-based user interface, a company can structure its business processes and deliver business content according to the needs of certain user groups. </html>

<html> <head>
</head> <body> Knowledge Management (KM) is the umbrella term for the management of unstructured information, that is, all kinds of documents. The KM capability of SAP NetWeaver turns unstructured information into organizational knowledge. </body> </html>

<html> The business challenge is to transform unstructured information into organizational knowledge by structuring and classifying it in such a way that it becomes assessable and relevant to the enterprise's knowledge workers. </html>

<html> Knowledge Management as part of SAP NetWeaver provides an opportunity within your organization to connect those who know with those who need to know. Its functionality helps companies manage all facets of unstructured information. </html>
<html> The open KM platform offers user-centric services that provide a single access point to 3rd party repositories and SAP's own content management systems. </html>
<html> The Knowledge Management platform provides access to an organization's unstructured documents. Its major functional areas are Content Management and Search and Classification (TREX). </html>

<html> <head>
</head> <body> With SAP NetWeaver Portal collaboration tools you can get virtual rooms which contain all the best communication features such as instant messaging and bulletin boards. </body> </html>
<html> SAP Employee Self-Service (ESS) is a powerful suite of applications, tailored to the needs of today's lean, mobile workforce. </html>
<html> Using SAP ESS, employees maintain their own personal information and control many administrative transactions and other processes once handled by the HR staff. </html>
<html> SAP ESS not only grants better access to personal data, it informs employees as they move through life and work changes, by combining applications with support information. </html>
<html> The Business Package for Employee Self-Service integrates the functionality of the existing ESS in the Enterprise Portal. </html>
<html> ESS business process leveraging the SAP NetWeaver Portal saves hours of duplicated effort and employee time, and reduces the work load on the HR department. </html>
<html> The Business Package for SAP Manager Self-Service business primarily supports the following roles (types of employees): line managers, team and project leaders and heads of department. </html>
<html> SAP MSS has a profound impact on your company by providing tools that help all your managers to accomplish their goals more efficient, effective, and proactive. </html>

<html> Central departments such as Controlling or HR can make information available in the user's portal in a personalized way, so that managers find "their" information in "their" portal, in the right place at the right time. </html>

<html> Empowering managers to execute human capital and finance management strategies for budgeting, recruitment, compensation, and cost management also creates real return on investment (ROI) for your finance and HR departments. </html>

<html> Using SAP NetWeaver Portal, you can create a comprehensive personnel record for the manager that shows the details of the employee's salary history compared to company averages, work background, and vacation time by accessing multiple databases and programs. </html>
<html> SAP NetWeaver Business Intelligence is a robust and scalable data warehouse. </html>
<html> The reporting and analysis tools within SAP NetWeaver Business Intelligence offer a quick and easy way to gain access to the information you need. </html>

<html> <head>
</head> <body> The SAP NetWeaver Business Intelligence application provides warehouse management tools, which let you integrate and store data from sources throughout the organization and beyond - sources that contribute to strategic analysis and decision making. </body> </html>

<html> Data warehouse management, business modeling, and extraction, transformation, and loading enable you to build data warehouses, model information architecture according to business structure, and manage data from multiple sources. </html>
<html> Data warehousing enables you to build data warehouses, model an information architecture according to business structure, and manage data from multiple sources. </html>

<html> The application platform of SAP NetWeaver is the SAP NetWeaver Application Server. It provides a complete infrastructure to develop, deploy and run platform-independent, robust and scalable Web Services and business applications. </html>

<html> The major key capability of SAP NetWeaver Application Server is the full support for both the proven ABAP technology and the innovative open source internet-driven technologies Java, Java Enterprise Edition (JEE) and Web Services. </html>

<html> <head>
</head> <body> SAP NetWeaver Application Server integrates the ABAP and Java personalities in one application server, a homogeneous infrastructure for Java-based and ABAP-based applications. </body> </html>
<html> SAP NetWeaver Application Server brings together the benefits of a proven, scalable and reliable infrastructure with the interoperability and flexibility of Web Services technology. </html>

<html> Web Dynpro, a modeling environment for creating user interfaces, is used to build the presentation layer, including sophisticated user interfaces by modeling, rather than by writing code. SAP NetWeaver Application Server contains the runtime environment for Web Dynpro. </html>
<html> The Internet Communication Manager is the collection of services that allows SAP NetWeaver Application Server to talk to the outside world through Web pages. </html>

<html> SAP NetWeaver Application Server comes with the Java Development Infrastructure, which helps keep track of the components that are related to each other. It also automatically rebuilds a program as needed and helps package programs for distribution. </html>

<html> <head>
</head> <body> SAP NetWeaver Application Server is closely related to SAP Business Suite and to SAP NetWeaver. For both, SAP NetWeaver Application Server acts as the run time environment and provides that last bit of integration needed. </body> </html>

<html> The Business Workflow process control framework of SAP NetWeaver Application Server can describe and automate all the steps in a complex process with lots of moving parts using model-driven approach. </html>
<html> Once the installation is finished you can begin using the SAP NetWeaver Portal to monitor software. </html>
<html> Once the installation is finished you can begin using the SAP NetWeaver Portal to perfom hardware and software upgrades as required. </html>
<html> The SAP partners HP and Sun offer hardware components which are tailored and configured according to the requirements of SAP NetWeaver Rapid Installer. </html>

<html> <head>
</head> <body> SAP NetWeaver Rapid Installer provides backend connectivity to systems for Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), Business Warehouse (BW) and Customer Relationship Management (CRM). </body> </html>
<html> SAP Rapid Installer reduces complexity of installation and configuration processes and speeds up implementation time. </html>

<html> <head>
</head> <body> SAP NetWeaver Rapid Installer supports a clearly defined set of customer scenarios for SAP CRM and SAP ERP applications. With the installation wizard you can choose which scenario you would like to install. </body> </html>

area.name: smd
area.item:
Use
Select the database cluster group to be configured to run on this additional cluster node.

Use
Specify the connection type for connecting the Diagnostics Agent to diagnostics in SAP Solution Manager.

Dependencies
There are the following ways to connect the Diagnostics Agent to SAP Solution Manager:
  • P4 connection via SCS message server (recommended):
    The Diagnostics Agent contacts the Java EE message server of the managing system on the HTTP port (81xx) to retrieve the P4 port (5xx04) of one of the dispatcher nodes running in the Java EE cluster (using a load balancing mechanism). This kind of connection supports high-availability SAP Solution Manager systems.
  • Direct P4 connection via Java EE dispatcher node:
    The Diagnostics Agent tries to establish a direct connection to the P4 port (5xx04) of the Java EE dispatcher node of the SAP Solution Manager system.

Definition
Specify the connection option of the Diagnostics Agent to diagnostics in SAP Solution Manager.

Use
You can choose:
  • To configure the connection of the Diagnostics Agent to diagnostics in SAP Solution Manager
  • Not to configure the connection

Dependencies
You can choose not to configure the connection if your installation scenario does not require connection to SAP Solution Manager.

Use
Specify the connection type for connecting the Diagnostics Agent to diagnostics in SAP Solution Manager.

Dependencies
There are the following ways to connect the Diagnostics Agent to SAP Solution Manager:
  • P4 SSL connection via SCS message server (recommended):
    The Diagnostics Agent contacts the Java EE message server of the managing system on the HTTP port (81xx) to retrieve the P4S port (5xx06) of one of the dispatcher nodes running in the Java EE cluster (using a load balancing mechanism). This kind of connection supports high-availability SAP Solution Manager systems.
  • Direct P4 SSL connection via Java EE dispatcher node:
    The Diagnostics Agent tries to establish a direct connection to the P4S port (5xx06) of the Java EE dispatcher node of the SAP Solution Manager system.All the data transferred by this channel are encrypted.

Use
Enter the host name of the Java stack in your SAP Solution Manager system

Definition
Java EE P4 port of the Java stack in your SAP Solution Manager system

Use
The following naming convention applies:
5<Instance Number>04, where <Instance Number> is the central instance number of the Java Stack in your SAP Solution Manager System.

Example
If the instance number of the Java stack in your SAP Solution Manager system is 02, the number of the Java EE P4 port is as follows:
50204

Definition
HTTP message server port of the Java stack in your SAP Solution Manager system

Use
The following naming convention applies:
81<SCS Instance Number>, where <SCS Instance Number> is the Central Services (SCS) instance number of the Java Stack in your SAP Solution Manager System

Example
If the Central Services (SCS) instance number of the Java stack in your SAP Solution Manager system is 02, the number of the HTTP message server port is as follows:
8102

Definition
Java EE P4 SSL port of the Java stack in your SAP Solution Manager system

Use
The following naming convention applies: 5<Instance Number>06, where <Instance Number> is the central instance number of the Java Stack in your SAP Solution Manager System.

Example
If the instance number of the Java stack in your SAP Solution Manager system is 02, the number of the Java EE P4 SSL port is as follows: 50206

Use
Enter the existing password for this user.

Definition
Technical identifier for internal processes, consisting of a two-digit number from 97 to 00

Use
Enter the instance number to be created for this specific instance. If more than one SAP instance is running on the same host, these instances must be assigned different numbers.

The directory of the Diagnostics Agent instance is named SMDA<Instance Number>.

Definition
The route string describes the stations of a connection required between the Diagnostics Agent and diagnostics in SAP Solution Manager.

Use
The route string contains a substring for each SAProuter without the target server such as:
/H/host/S/service/W/pass
  • /H/ indicates the host name
  • /S/ is used for specifying the service (port); it is an optional entry, the default value is 3299
  • /W/ indicates the password for the connection between the predecessor and successor on the route and is also optional (default is “”, no password)
Example
The route between the Diagnostics Agent and diagnostics in SAP Solution Manager can be such as:
/H/hostname.sap.com/S/3199

Definition
Identifier for your Diagnostics Agent

Dependencies
  • We recommend that you choose DAA if DAA is not already used as the SAP system ID by an SAP system that is not a Diagnostics Agent. If DAA is already used, we recommend that you choose a Diagnostics Agent system ID <DASID>, such as DA1, DA2 ... DA9. This helps you to distinguish installed Diagnostics Agents from installed SAP systems more easily.

  • Make sure that the <DASID>:
    • Either does not yet exist on the local installation host, or does already exist but exclusively contains some Diagnostics Agent installation with the same release as this you are going to install.
    • The ID must consist of exactly three alphanumeric characters.
    • Only uppercase letters are allowed.
    • The first character must be a letter (not a digit).
    • It must not include the IDs listed in SAP Note 1979280 because they are reserved and cannot be used.

Use
Select the shared drive for the clustered SAP instances to be installed.

Example
This is the drive where the Diagnostics Agent instance is installed.

Use
Choose the System Landscape Directory (SLD) destination as follows:
  • If you choose Register in existing SLD, you specify the SLD connection parameters to register the Diagnostics Agent that you are installing in an existing System Landscape Directory (SLD).

  • If you choose No SLD Destination, you specify a direct connection to the managing system (which must be up and running).

Definition
HTTP host of the SAP system with the System Landscape Directory (SLD) that is assigned to the managed system on which the Diagnostics Agent is being installed

Use
Enter the fully qualified name (FQN) of this host.

Definition
HTTP port of the SAP system with the System Landscape Directory (SLD) that is assigned to the managed system on which the Diagnostics Agent is being installed

Use
The following naming convention applies:
5<Instance Number>00.

Example
If the number of the SAP system instance is 01, the number of the HTTP port is as follows:
50100

Use
Enter the existing password for this user.

Use
Enter the name of the user for the central System Landscape Directory (SLD).

Definition
Location of the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) libraries

Use
See SAP Note 1448655 for more information about the required Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) libraries and how to download them.

Use
Enter the name of the managing user (with administrator role).
We recommend that you enter the SMD_ADMIN user, which is created when you execute the Diagnostics Configuration activity from the Basic Configuration scenario of SOLMAN_SETUP (Robomate).

Use
You can install a Diagnostics Agent on a virtual host or on this physical host (local host).
Change the value of Host name only if you want to install the Diagnostics Agent on a virtual host.

Definition
Virtual host name (network name) of the cluster group.

The virtual host name is used by the Diagnostics Agent instance.
All application servers use the virtual host name to connect to the Diagnostics Agent instance.
The virtual host name is also a global host name, as the global files are located on the shared disk.

Dependencies
You have already reserved the virtual host name (network name) and its IP address on a DNS Server.

Enter the name of the host on which the ERS instance is to be installed.

Use
Select this checkbox if you want to - apart from restarting the primary application server (PAS) instance - also automatically start the remaining local instances of your SAP system after the installation of the ABAP central services (ASCS) instance has finished.

Use
Select this checkbox if you want to automatically start the primary application server (PAS) instance after the installation of the ABAP central services (ASCS) instance has finished.

area.name: Syscopy
area.item:
Use
Choose this option if you want to specify the export of the ABAP part of the system.

Definition
Choose this option if you want to specify the options for task file generation and data load. You do not usually need to change the default values.

Definition
Communication port can be any free local port from 1024 to 65535.

Use
Specify whether
  • ONLY the target system will exist after the system copy and thus replace the source system (move)
or
  • the target system and the source system will BOTH continue to exist after the system copy (copy).
    Caution: The target system will be inactive after the copy.
We recommend that you do not select this option.
For more information, see SAP Note 859886 for software unit PI and SAP Note 877029 for software unit DI.

Use
If you want to use optimizations for SAP Business Suite, you can enable ABAP table declustering / depooling for your SAP system. For more information, see SAP Note 1892354.

Use
Select this option only if you chose to decluster / depool all database tables in the database instance installation or system copy export step.

Definition
Used to share information about package processing between export servers and import servers.

Definition
Exports the packages according to their names in alphabetical order.

Definition
Exports the packages according to their names in custom order.

Definition
Location where the export of the source database is to be stored

Definition
Used to transfer dump files from export servers to import servers

Definition
Used to share information about package processing between export servers and import servers.

Definition
Name or IP address of the FTP host

Definition
Name of the FTP user

Definition
Name or IP address of the import host.

Use
Choose this option if you want to specify the export of the Java part of the system.

Use
  • Little-Endian: Select this option if the target system runs on little-endian hardware.
  • Big-Endian: Select this option if the target system runs on big-endian hardware.

    For more information, see SAP Note 552464.

Definition
The specified R3load options will be applied when loading the data.

Definition
For a heterogeneous system copy you need a valid migration key. The migration key can be generated at https://support.sap.com/migrationkey.

Definition
The Migration Monitor Controller adjusts the number of R3load jobs depending on the current load of the SAP HANA database instance.
To influence the load calculation, which affects the number R3load jobs, you can set several parameters.

Use
Experienced users can change the parameters used for load calculation. The parameters are read by the Migration Monitor Controller before every calculation interval, which is 5 seconds by default.

Dependencies
Changes in the default values can result in a sub-optimal number of R3load jobs, which can negatively impact the import time.

Example
This is a short description of the parameters:
  • WeightCounter 1
  • MemoryFactor 12
    Necessary amount of memory is multiplied by this parameter. It directly affects the number of R3load jobs.

  • InitialLargeJobNum 5
    Minimum number of R3load jobs for group Large.

  • InitialSmallJobNum 12
    Minimum number of R3load jobs for group Small.

  • CoreMultiplicator 4
    Used mainly to calculate the maximum number of R3load jobs.

  • CustomGroupLarge
    Separate group for tables or packages.

  • CustomGroupLargeJobNum
    Number of jobs for large custom group.

  • CustomGroupMedium
    Separate group for tables or packages.

  • CustomGroupMediumJobNum
    Number of jobs for medium custom group.

  • CustomGroupSmall
    Separate group for tables or packages.

  • CustomGroupSmallJobNum
    Number of jobs for small custom group.

  • Pause false
    If set to true, the controller skips all calculations.

Definition
Used to share information about package processing between export servers and import servers.

Definition
Name of this package (the name of the DB-independent control file, such as SAPAPPL0.STR or SAPCLUST.STR).

Definition
Defines the order in which the packages are loaded. The load starts with the lowest value.

Definition
Size of the R3load data file PACKAGE.001, .. PACKAGE.00n. Value in MB.

Definition
Name of this package (the name of the DB-independent control file, such as SAPAPPL0.STR or SAPCLUST.STR).

Definition
Define the order in which the packages are unloaded. The unload starts with the lowest value.

Use
Select this option if you want to run export and import in parallel.

Definition
Password of the FTP user

Use
Enter the path to the directory where the SQL files generated by SMIGR_CREATE_DDL report are located.

Use
Choose the required option:
  • Select Use Exchange Directory if export and import are to communicate using the exchange directory.
  • Select Use Sockets if export and import are to work through the socket connection.

Use

Network Share: Select this option if import directories are mounted as a network share.

FTP: Select this option if import directories are accessible using FTP.

Use
Splitting STR files results in more and smaller data packages generated during the unload. This leads to better parallel processing of the data packages during unload and load, so reducing the overall runtime.

Use
To ensure data consistency, you have to stop running SAP instances before you start the unloading of data.
If the data in the target system do not have to be consistent, because you are performing a system copy test - for example to validate the system copy procedure or to measure runtime - you can also perform the export with a running instance.

Use
There are two kind of split options: '%<number of table parts>' and ':<number of rows per part>'

Example
%5 means - split the table into 5 parts
:100000 means - split the table into parts with 100000 rows

Use
You can choose from the following database types:
  • SAP HANA database

Definition
The specified R3load options will be applied when generating the task files.

Use
If you choose this option, you can test the FTP connection immediately.

Definition
Select this option if the target system is a Unicode system.

Definition
The specified R3load options are applied when the task files have been unloaded.

Use
Select this option if you want to copy the system by using database specific tools.

area.name: SystemRename
area.item:
Definition
Database schema for AS ABAP

Use
The schema was renamed during the rename of the database instance. You need to specify the new name.

Definition
Host name used for this instance

Definition
New host name used for this instance

Use
If you plan to use a virtual host name, make sure that the virtual host name is bound to a local network interface.

Definition
The instance profile provides configuration parameters for an instance, e.g. an application server. The following SAP naming conventions apply: <SID>_<instance name>_<host name>

Definition
Host name of the global host with the global file system and sapmnt share

Definition
The SAP system mount directory <sapmnt> and subdirectories must be physically shared with Network File System (NTFS) and mounted for all hosts belonging to the same SAP system.

Use
For each SAP system there is a subdirectory <SID> with the following subdirectories:
  • exe
  • global
  • profile

The exe directory contains executable kernel programs. The profile directory contains the start and operations profiles of all instances.

Definition
The target ASCS or SCS instance host name for which the enqueue replication server to be renamed replicates the lock table.

Dependencies
You must have already renamed the corresponding ASCS or SCS instance.

Definition
The target ASCS or SCS instance number for which the enqueue replication server to be renamed replicates the lock table.

Dependencies
You must have already renamed the corresponding ASCS or SCS instance.

Definition
<What is this field for? What does this field mean?>

Use
<What happens when I enter a value or set an flag? Under what circumstances do I use the field? What do I enter in this field and why (no specific values)?>

Dependencies
<What other fields or functions does this field influence? Are there other effects that I might not expect? Are there restrictions? >

Example
<Is this field has a certain value or setting, what happens?>

area.name: TREX
area.item:
Definition
TREX supports all main European and Asian languages for indexing and searching.

Use
Only select the languages that are relevant. This optimizes performance during the language recognition process and therefore during the search and indexing process. The language recognition process gives better results if as few languages as possible are used. You can also change settings for the language recognition after the installation.

Use
Enter the name of the host on which the SAP Gateway is installed.

Use
Enter the instance number for the SAP Gateway that you specified during the installation of the SAP Gateway.

Example
47 for sapgw47

Use
If the application communicates with TREX using an HTTP connection, check the field HTTP Server.

Definition
The destination directory is: <drive>:\usr\sap\trex_<instancenumber>
(Windows only)

Use
Choose whether you want to install a new or upgrade an existing TREX instance.

Dependencies
If you want to upgrade an existing TREX Instance, it will be checked whether there are already existing instances.

Use
You can configure a second index server for each TREX instance. The setting for this value depends on the ram size of the machine. To address more than 4GB, you should use 2 instances. The installation checks this for you, so you can retain the default value.

Use
You can configure multiple preprocessor instances per TREX instance. The Software Provisioning Manager increases this parameter on LINUX according to the number of CPUs. You can decrease this value if you do not want to use all your CPUs for TREX.

Use
You can configure multiple RFC server instances per TREX instance. You should increase this parameter depending on the number of concurrent RFC requests.

Use
As the proxy server should not be used for internal addresses, define exclusion rules for internal addresses.
These rules define when the proxy server is not to be used. Separate multiple entries using a semicolon.
You may not use asterisks as placeholders.

Example
Examples of exclusion rules:
  • Do not use the proxy server to get URLs that end with mycompany.com
  • Do not use the proxy server to get IP addresses that start with 10

Use
Specify the password defined for the user. You can change the user and password for accessing the proxy server using a script later on. The password is encrypted.

Definition
If you want to index documents and Web pages on external servers you should specify a proxy server (e.g. for security reasons).

Use
Specifiy the host name and domain of the proxy server.

Example
proxy.mylocation.mycompany.com

Use
Specify the port of the proxy server.

Example
8080

Use
Specify the user name needed to access the proxy server.

Use
If the application communicates with TREX using an RFC connection, check the field RFC Server.

Definition
An index snapshot is a complete copy of an index that is needed for index replication. Index replication is an important procedure for managing and updating large indexes in a distributed TREX system.

Use
You specify the directory for the index snapshots if you want to build a distributed TREX system landscape.

Definition
If you want to upgrade an exisiting TREX instance, you need to specify the TREX instance the upgrade is supposed to be applied to.

Use
Enter the user who should own the TREX instance.

Use
Enter the password for the TREX user.

Use
Enter the user who owns the TREX instance.

area.name: tutorial
area.item:
Definition
Whatever I write here, it should be meaningful as it will be part of the Installation Development Tutorial

area.name: UME
area.item:
Definition
Administrator of the Java application server of the system.

Use
The installation sets the user ID J2EE_ADMIN by default.
You can accept the default user ID or enter another user ID according to your requirements.

Definition
User ID of the ABAP communication user

Use
The installation sets the user ID SAPJSF by default.
You can accept the default user ID or enter another user ID according to your requirements.

Dependencies
This user is not a dialog user. It is used for RFC communication between the ABAP application server and the Java application server.

Definition
User for anonymous access

Use
The installation sets the user ID J2EE_GUEST by default.
You can accept the default user ID or enter another user ID according to your requirements.

Use
The installation sets the master password by default.
If required, you can choose another password according to your requirements.
If you are not sure about the password policy, ask your system administrator.

Definition
User ID of the administrator of the Java application server

Use
Enter the user ID of the Administrator User that is defined as administrator for this central UME. The installation sets the user ID J2EE_ADM_<SAPSID_Java_System> by default.

Dependencies
The Administrator User must already exist on the external ABAP system along with the appropriate Administrator Role. We recommend that you choose the user ID J2EE_ADM_<SAPSID_Java_System> when creating this user.
For more information, see Preparing an External ABAP System as Source for User Data in the Java installation guide for your operating system and database, available at: http://support.sap.com/sltoolset -> System Provisioning

Definition
Administrator role that exists on the external ABAP system used for the user management engine (UME) users.

Use
Enter the Administrator Role that exists in the external ABAP system. The installation sets the role ID SAP_J2EE_GUEST by default.

Dependencies
The Administrator Role must already exist on the external ABAP system along with the appropriate Administrator User. We recommend that you choose the role ID SAP_J2EE_ADMIN when creating this role.
For more information, see Preparing an External ABAP System as Source for User Data in the Java installation guide for your operating system and database, available at: http://support.sap.com/sltoolset -> System Provisioning

Use
Enter the instance number of the primary application server instance of the external ABAP system to which you want to connect the Java application server.

Unix:
To find out the number, look under the SAP directory /usr/sap/<SAPSID>/DVEBMGS<nn> on the host of the primary application server instance. The value <nn> is the instance number.

Windows:
To find out the instance number, look under the SAP directory <Drive>:\usr\sap\<SAPSID>\DVEBMGS<nn> on the host of the primary application server instance. The value <nn> is the instance number.

Use
Enter the client of the external ABAP system that you want to use for central user management.
For more information, see Preparing an External ABAP System as Source for User Data in the Java installation guide for your operating system and database, available at https://support.sap.com/sloolset -> System Provisioning .

Definition
User ID of the existing ABAP communication user

Use
Enter the user ID of the existing ABAP Communication User. The installation sets the user ID SAPJSF by default.

Dependencies
The ABAP Communication User must already exist in the external ABAP system. We recommend that you choose the user ID SAPJSF when creating this user.
For more information, see Preparing an External ABAP System as Source for User Data in the Java installation guide for your operating system and database, available at: http://support.sap.com/sltoolset -> System Provisioning

Definition
User for anonymous access

Use
Enter the name of the existing Guest User. The installation sets the user ID J2EE_GST_<SAPSID_Java_System> by default.

Dependencies
The Guest User for the SAP Java system must already exist on the external ABAP system along with the appropriate Guest Role. We recommend that you choose the user ID J2EE_GST_<SAPSID_Java_System> when creating this user.
For more information, see Preparing an External ABAP System as Source for User Data in the Java installation guide for your SAP system application, available at https://support.sap.com/sloolset -> System Provisioning .

Definition
Guest role that exists on the central ABAP UME system.

Use
Enter the name of the Guest Role that exists on the central ABAP UME system.

Dependencies
The Guest Role must already exist on the external ABAP system along with the appropriate Guest User.
For more information, see Preparing an External ABAP System as Source for User Data in the Java installation guide for your operating system and database, available at: http://support.sap.com/sltoolset -> System Provisioning

Definition
User ID of the administrator of the Java application server.

Use
The installation sets the user ID Administrator by default.
If required, you can choose another name according to your requirements.

Use
The installation sets the master password by default.
If required, you can choose another password according to your requirements.
If you are not sure about the password policy, ask your system administrator.

Definition
User for anonymous access to the Java application server

Use
The installation sets the user ID Guest by default. You can accept the default user ID or enter another user ID according to your requirements.

area.name: usage
area.item:
Use
Select software units for configuration.

Installs all software unit available for this product.

Definition
Installs all software units available for SAP NetWeaver.

Definition
Controls whether components on the system will be checked against components to be delivered in SCA archives.

Use
If set, components that will be delivered will first be checked for consistency with the existing system.

Use
Name of the software unit.

Use
You use the Java Support Package Manager (JSPM) to update runtime systems with SAP Support Packages. To synchronize any modifications with software components developed in usage type DI of SAP NetWeaver (NWDI for short) the JSPM must exchange information about the software components involved. Select the checkbox to mark runtime systems for JSPM as being used by usage type DI.

area.name: XI
area.item:

To find out the host name, enter hostname at the command prompt of the SAP Exchange Infrastructure host.

SAP XI user that can connect to the System Landscape Directory.

Use

To install the Adapter Engine (J2SE), the SAP System Delivery Manager (SDM) is installed on your host under a unique SAP path ( /sap/<System Name>/java), where you need to define the System Name.
